input: When will Initial Bid Awards be published electronically?
output: Initial Bid Awards will be published electronically by 1800 ET six (6) hours after the closing of the bid.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8G Bidding and Awarding Timetable

input: What is the duration of the Transition period?
output: The Transition period lasts no less than sixty-four (64) hours after the initial bids are posted.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8G Bidding and Awarding Timetable

input: When will Final Bid Awards be published electronically?
output: Final Bid Awards will be published twenty-four (24) hours after the posting of the Relief Line awards.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8G Bidding and Awarding Timetable

input: What is the deadline for submitting recommendations to Crew Planning regarding preliminary pairings and lines?
output: The Scheduling Committee has forty-eight (48) hours from the time of receipt to review the information and submit recommendations, in accordance with this Agreement.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8G Bidding and Awarding Timetable

input: When does Credit Restoration begin after the Transition period ends?
output: Credit Restoration begins immediately after the Transition period ends.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8G Bidding and Awarding Timetable

input: How long is the Open Time request processing window following Credit Restoration?
output: The Company processes Open Time requests and awards/assigns trips following Credit Restoration in accordance with paragraph K.1. below, for a period of twenty-four (24) hours.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8G Bidding and Awarding Timetable

input: As a flight attendant, can I request schedule adjustments during the current month?
output: No, schedule adjustments are only allowed on days you were originally scheduled to fly within the first four days of the month. Adjustments cannot be made while you're working in the current month.

input: What happens if I have an overnight on the last day of my current bid month?
output: The overnight will be indicated on your schedule, and you will fly with the Flight Attendant assigned to you during the current bid month for the entire pairing.

input: How does my projected credit hours change if I have a contractual or regulatory Lead-in conflict?
output: If you lose projected credit hours due to a Lead-in conflict, your monthly guarantee will be reduced by the number of credit hours lost. You can restore credit during Credit Restoration in accordance with paragraph K.1.

input: What are my options if my trip overlaps into days off the following month?
output: You have two options: work the trip and be credited for additional hours, or work the trip and drop a trip or Reserve Day to restore days off later in the month without credit protection. The specific trip or Reserve Day to be dropped will be mutually agreed upon by you and Crew Scheduling, subject to Critical Day considerations.

input: What happens if my trip overlaps into days off the following month, and I'm scheduled for fewer than the minimum guaranteed days off?
output: In this case, you will work the trip and be credited for additional hours. You can then elect to either drop Reserve Days or a trip with the fewest number of calendar days necessary to restore your minimum days off in the new month, subject to Critical Day and/or holiday weekend considerations, with credit protection. Alternatively, you may choose to be paid 4.0 hours of credit above guarantee for each Day Off Restoration (MDD/MDO), which will apply to Overtime Incentive Pay pursuant to Section 3.G.

input: How do I request schedule adjustments if my trip overlaps into days off the following month?
output: You can make requests between Initial Award and Final Bid Awards by contacting Crew Planning. If you don't make a selection within the required timeframe, you will be paid according to option b. above.

input: What is considered a multiple day trip?
output: A pairing that spans more than one calendar day is considered a multiple day trip.

input: As a flight attendant, I'm scheduled for training during my work schedule. What happens if I have trips that overlap with this training assignment?
output: During the Transition Period, any trips that overlap with your training assignment will be dropped in their entirety to accommodate your training requirements. This means you won't lose any projected credit hours due to a contractual or regulatory Training conflict. If you do end up losing credit hours, your monthly guarantee will be reduced by the number of hours lost. However, you'll have the opportunity to restore these credit hours during Credit Restoration in accordance with paragraph K.1.

input: What happens if my vacation overlaps with a trip, and I am scheduled for both?
output: During the Transition Period, any trips that overlap with your vacation will be dropped entirely to avoid contractual or regulatory conflicts. If this results in a reduction of projected credit hours, your monthly guarantee will be adjusted accordingly. However, you'll have the chance to regain those credits during Credit Restoration according to paragraph K.1.

input: What happens if I have a projected credit deficit below 72 hours due to dropped trips from conflicts? Can I restore my lost credits?
output: If you have a projected credit deficit below 72 hours due to dropped trips resulting from conflicts, you won't be required to restore the lost credit. Instead, your guarantee will be reduced by the number of credited hours the dropped trip(s) projects you below the guarantee. However, if you wish to restore your credits, you can submit multiple requests for Open Time trips that operate anytime during the month. This bid will be open for 24 hours and awarded in seniority order. Keep in mind that you may waive contractual legalities and the minimum number of days off in the bid month if you pick up additional flying days that bring you below the Section 7.D. minimum days off.

input: What happens to my Initial Open Time after my schedule has been adjusted due to Lead-in, Training, Vacation, or other conflicts? Can I use it for credit restoration?
output: After your schedule has been adjusted for the upcoming bid period due to Lead-in, Training, Vacation, or other conflicts, all Initial Open Time will be made available for credit restoration and line improvement. This Initial Open Time will be posted electronically, allowing you to use it to restore your credits and improve your schedule. Remember that you can only use the Initial Open Time for this purpose if there are no legalities or minimum days off requirements that would prevent you from doing so.

input: Can I restore my lost credit if I have a deficit that doesn't result in a projected schedule of less than 72 hours? How does it work for Line Improvement?
output: If you are a lineholder with a credit deficit that doesn't result in a projected schedule of less than 72 hours, you can restore your lost credit up to four (4) hours above your original Line value on a voluntary basis. To do this, you can pick up Open Time trips that operate at any time during the month. These requests will be awarded in seniority order. Additionally, as a lineholder, you may submit multiple requests to improve your Line by adding trips only, increasing your credit time. These awards will also be made in seniority order. Keep in mind that for both scenarios, you can only do this if there are no legalities or minimum days off requirements that would prevent you from doing so.

input: As a flight attendant, how can I participate in Seniority-based Open Time bidding (SOT)?
output: To participate in SOT as a lineholder, you may submit multiple requests to improve your line by adding trips, dropping trips, or trading trips. Your awards will be made in seniority order during the three rounds of SOT, which are open for no less than eighteen (18) hours each.

input: What happens if I waive contractual legalities as a lineholder?
output: If you waive contractual legalities as a lineholder, it may impact your rights and benefits according to the collective bargaining agreement. It is important to understand the implications of such a decision before proceeding.

input: How are awards made during Seniority-based Open Time bidding (SOT)?
output: Awards during SOT are made based on seniority, with lineholders receiving trips in order of their seniority number. The Company will post the awards electronically no later than thirty (30) hours after bid close.

input: Can I pick up additional days of flying that bring me below my Section 7.D minimum days off?
output: Yes, as a lineholder, you have the option to pick up additional days of flying that bring you below your Section 7.D minimum days off. However, this will be considered a waiver of the minimum number of days off for the bid month.

input: How long are the rounds of Seniority-based Open Time bidding (SOT) open?
output: Each round of SOT is open for no less than eighteen (18) hours, providing ample time for lineholders to submit their requests and adjust their schedules accordingly.

input: How are Daily Open Time requests processed for flight attendants?
output: Daily Open Time requests from flight attendants are processed in first come, first served order. These requests can be waived by the flight attendant if they choose to do so. All awards will be posted electronically, and the company maintains an electronic system for flight attendant use of daily open time.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L Daily Open Time and Electronic Trade Board

input: What is the Electronic Trade Board?
output: The Electronic Trade Board is an online platform that allows regular line holders, relief line holders (and reserves picking up on GDOs, including moveable days immediately following a GDO) to request trip drops, trip pick-ups, and trip swaps with other flight attendants on a first-come, first-served daily basis. These transactions are processed in near real time.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L Daily Open Time and Electronic Trade Board

input: Is there a cost for flight attendants to access the electronic system?
output: No, flight attendants will have free online access to the Daily Open Time and Electronic Trade Board systems. The cost of a flight attendant’s internet connection will be paid for by the flight attendant.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L Daily Open Time and Electronic Trade Board

input: What adjustments can be made through voluntary transactions in accordance with this agreement?
output: Flight attendants may increase their block time in accordance with Section 7.C, trade a trip for another trip of fewer, more or the same number of days or hours, and pick up additional days of flying that bring them below their Section 7.D minimum days off. These adjustments are legal pursuant to this agreement and the FARs unless otherwise stated.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L Daily Open Time and Electronic Trade Board

input: How does waiving the one (1) calendar day in a seven (7) day period impact other company assignments?
output: If a flight attendant waives the one (1) calendar day in a seven (7) day period as part of a transaction, it will not constitute a waiver of that requirement for other company assignments not impacted by the transaction.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L Daily Open Time and Electronic Trade Board

input: What is the nature of the electronic trade board system?
output: The electronic trade board system is a near real-time system that logs all transactions. It includes all open time for the month, such as open Reserve periods, as soon as the trip or Reserve period becomes available. This system allows flight attendants to view and adjust their schedules in a timely manner.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L Daily Open Time and Electronic Trade Board

input: What happens to a flight attendant's credit time when they decrease it through a voluntary adjustment transaction?
output: When a flight attendant decreases their credit time through a voluntary adjustment transaction, their credit is reduced accordingly. If the transaction projects the flight attendant below the minimum monthly credited hours, their guarantee will be reduced by the number of credited hours they are projected to fall short of the guarantee. This ensures that flight attendants maintain their minimum monthly credited hours and are not penalized for making adjustments to their schedule.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L Daily Open Time and Electronic Trade Board

input: As a flight attendant, when can I request mutual trip trades with daily open time?
output: You may request mutual trip trades within the electronic trade platform (currently FLiCA) during the Daily Open Time posting period. This allows you to exchange trips with another flight attendant who also has trips in Daily Open Time, subject to Company approval.

input: As a flight attendant, can I pick up a trip from Daily Open Time that originates from a base other than my own?
output: Yes, you can pick up a trip originating from a base other than your own if it has remained in Daily Open Time for at least twenty-four (24) hours without being claimed by a flight attendant based at the originating base. This allows you to have the opportunity to cover the trip, subject to Company approval and the waiver of any days off that were forfeited as a result of picking up Open Time.

input: As a flight attendant, when can a trip in Daily Open Time be assigned to a Reserve?
output: A trip in Daily Open Time will not be assigned to a Reserve before 1200 ET two (2) days prior to the day of the trip’s check-in. This ensures that you have the opportunity to pick up the trip or make arrangements if necessary, and the assignment of Reserve duties is done in accordance with Company policies and procedures.

input: As a flight attendant, how are Open Time Reserve periods awarded to Reserve line holders?
output: Open Time Reserve periods will first be awarded to Reserve line holders in a first-come first-served order. This means that if you have the same seniority number as another Reserve line holder and both of you are interested in the same period, the one who requests it first will get the assignment. This process is designed to ensure fairness and transparency in the allocation of Open Time Reserve periods among Reserve line holders.

input: As a flight attendant, how can I make changes to my schedule involving Daily Open Time trips within two (2) days of the trip’s departure time?
output: If you need to pick up a trip from Daily Open Time, drop a trip into Daily Open Time or trade a trip with Daily Open Time within two (2) days of the trip’s departure time, you can do so upon verbal short notice (i.e., within two (2) days of the Open Time trip). The changes will be awarded on a first-come, first-served basis, subject to Company approval. This allows for flexibility in adjusting your schedule under tight timelines while still adhering to Company policies and procedures.

input: As a flight attendant, what are my obligations when I forfeit days off while picking up Open Time?
output: When you forfeit days off to pick up Open Time, you are required to waive those days off. This means that if you choose to give up your previously scheduled days off in order to work an Open Time trip, you will not be entitled to those days off at a later time. The waiver of forfeited days off is a requirement for flight attendants who wish to maintain their scheduling flexibility and availability for future assignments.

input: As a flight attendant, how can I trade trips with Daily Open Time and what are the rules governing these trades?
output: You may trade trips within the same qualification by using the electronic trade platform (currently FLiCA). When requesting a trade, you must do so within two (2) days prior to the check-in time of the earlier trip. Open Time trades will be processed in first-come, first-served order, so it's important to submit your request as early as possible to increase your chances of getting the trade you want. Additionally, you may also trade for a trip within two (2) days of its departure date per Section 8.L.7.f., but this too will be on a first-come, first-served basis. It's important to review the specific rules and guidelines for trading trips to ensure that you comply with all applicable regulations and policies.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L8 Trades with Daily Open Time

input: As a flight attendant, what is the deadline for submitting open time trade requests and how are these requests processed?
output: To ensure that your open time trade request is considered, it must be received by 1200 ET two (2) days prior to the day of the check-in time of the earlier trip. This allows sufficient time for scheduling and processing the trade while also adhering to company policies and regulations. Open Time trades are processed in a first-come, first-served order, meaning that the request received first will be given priority over later requests. It is important to submit your request as early as possible to increase the likelihood of it being approved.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L8 Trades with Daily Open Time

input: As a flight attendant, under what circumstances can I trade for a trip within two (2) days of its departure date and how is this transaction processed?
output: According to Section 8.L.7.f, you are eligible to trade for a trip within two (2) days of its departure date. This transaction will be processed on a first-come, first-served basis, meaning that the request received first will be given priority over later requests. It is important to submit your request as early as possible to increase the likelihood of it being approved and to ensure a smooth scheduling process. Remember to follow all company policies and regulations when making trades to avoid any potential issues or conflicts with your schedule.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L8 Trades with Daily Open Time

input: As a flight attendant, when am I required to waive my days off due to a trip trade with Open Time that conflicts with my scheduled days off?
output: According to the regulations, you are required to waive any days off that were forfeited as a result of a trip trade with Open Time if it conflicts with your scheduled days off. This means that if you traded for a trip and ended up with days off that conflicted with your previously scheduled days off, you would be required to give up those days off in order to maintain compliance with the regulations. It is important to carefully consider any trip trades or schedule changes to avoid potential conflicts with your days off and ensure that you are able to fulfill your duties as a flight attendant without any issues.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L8 Trades with Daily Open Time

input: As a flight attendant, under what circumstances can I trade a trip that spans a critical day?
output: According to the regulations, you may only trade a trip that spans a critical day if you pick up another trip that also spans the same critical day(s). This means that if you are scheduled for a trip that includes a critical day and you wish to trade it, you must find another trip that covers the same critical day(s) in order to maintain compliance with the regulations. It is important to be aware of any critical days in your schedule and to carefully consider any trip trades or schedule changes to ensure that you are able to fulfill your duties as a flight attendant without any issues.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L8 Trades with Daily Open Time

input: As a flight attendant, under what conditions can I trade for a trip that originates from a base other than my own?
output: According to the regulations, you are able to trade for a trip that originates from a base other than your own only if it has remained in daily open time for twenty-four (24) hours without being picked up by a Flight Attendant based at the originating base. This means that if there is a trip available for trading that you are interested in, but it originates from a different base than yours, you can only trade for it if it has been open and unclaimed for twenty-four hours. After this time period has passed, you will be eligible to request the trade and potentially be assigned to the trip. It is important to stay informed about available trips and to act quickly when opportunities arise in order to successfully secure a trade.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L8 Trades with Daily Open Time

input: As a flight attendant, when can I request to drop a trip into open time?
output: According to the regulations, you may submit a request to drop a trip(s) into Open Time using the electronic trade platform (currently FLiCA) in accordance with the specified guidelines. In order to do so, you must make your request by 1200 ET two (2) days prior to the day of the trip's check-in time. This means that if you need to drop a trip due to personal circumstances or other reasons, you can submit a request through the electronic trade platform no later than two days before the scheduled check-in time for the trip. The decision to approve your request will be based on operational needs and the reserve staffing formula outlined in Appendix 1 of the CBA. It is important to plan ahead and make any necessary requests as soon as possible in order to minimize disruptions to scheduling and ensure that all parties involved are aware of any changes.

input: As a flight attendant, when can I request to drop a trip into open time?
output: According to the regulations, you may submit a request to drop a trip(s) into Open Time using the electronic trade platform (currently FLiCA) in accordance with the specified guidelines. In order to do so, you must make your request by 1200 ET two (2) days prior to the day of the trip's check-in time. This means that if you need to drop a trip due to personal circumstances or other reasons, you can submit a request through the electronic trade platform no later than two days before the scheduled check-in time for the trip. The decision to approve your request will be based on operational needs and the reserve staffing formula outlined in Appendix 1. It is important to plan ahead and make any necessary requests as soon as possible in order to minimize disruptions to scheduling and ensure that all parties involved are aware of any changes.

input: As a flight attendant, what are my options for trading trips with other crew members?
output: According to the regulations, you have the option to trade trips with other Flight Attendants who hold regular lines or relief lines within your base. These trades must be in accordance with the terms of the agreement and must also be legal under the Federal Aviation Regulations (FARs) for Flight Attendants. If you wish to make a trade that does not meet these requirements, it is important to seek approval from the company before proceeding. Additionally, verbal short notice trades may be permitted subject to company approval, so it's always best to check with your supervisor or crew scheduler before making any changes to your schedule.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L10 Trades with Other Flight Attendants

input: Can I offer my trip to another flight attendant on my day off?
output: Yes, as a Regular or Relief Line holder, you can offer your trip for pick up by other Flight Attendants in the same base on days off on a first come, first served basis.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L11 Trip Drops and Pick ups between Flight Attendants

input: What are the rules if I accept a pairing from another flight attendant?
output: If you accept a pairing from another flight attendant, you must waive your days off to the extent that the pairing reduces your days off. The pairing cannot create a conflict causing you to drop an originally scheduled pairing.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L11 Trip Drops and Pick ups between Flight Attendants

input: Can I pick up a trip on my day off if I am a Reserve line holder?
output: Yes, as a Reserve line holder, you may accept the pairing on immovable days off or moveable days(s) off immediately following immovable day(s) off. However, the pairing must be scheduled to return to base twelve (12) hours prior to your next Reserve Period.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L11 Trip Drops and Pick ups between Flight Attendants

input: What are the rules for waiving contractual limitations when picking up a trip?
output: When picking up a trip from another flight attendant, you must waive contractual limitations concerning minimum days off and consecutive days on duty.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L11 Trip Drops and Pick ups between Flight Attendants

input: Can I request to pick up a trip from another flight attendant if it is legal under the Flight Attendant FARs?
output: Yes, if a request to pick up a trip from another Flight Attendant is in accordance with the terms of this Agreement and is legal under the Flight Attendant FARs, the request will be approved.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L11 Trip Drops and Pick ups between Flight Attendants

input: As a Reserve flight attendant, can I request to move my days off?
output: Yes, as a Reserve flight attendant, you may request to move your days off in accordance with the provisions outlined in this section.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L12 Reserve Moves, Trades and Pick ups

input: Can I trade days off with another Reserve flight attendant?
output: Yes, you can trade days off with other Reserve Flight Attendants in accordance with the provisions outlined in this section.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L12 Reserve Moves, Trades and Pick ups

input: What is the process for picking up Reserve periods from Daily Open Time?
output: To pick up Reserve periods from Daily Open Time, you must follow the procedures and requirements specified in this section.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L12 Reserve Moves, Trades and Pick ups

input: How are transactions involving reserve periods in Open Time handled?
output: Transactions involving reserve periods in Open Time will be handled in accordance with Section 8.L.7.d. above, which outlines the specific procedures and requirements for such transactions.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L12 Reserve Moves, Trades and Pick ups

input: What are the rules for mutual Reserve day trades?
output: Mutual Reserve day trades will only be permitted from the “outside in” and must involve the same Reserve shift (e.g., RVA, RVB, etc.) as scheduled. Mutual trades resulting in a single Reserve Day will not be permitted.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L12 Reserve Moves, Trades and Pick ups

input: What are the rules for requesting to move my days off?
output: When requesting to move your days off, all involved days must be within the same bid period. Additionally, the move should not interfere with any assigned trips or other Company assignments.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L12 Reserve Moves, Trades and Pick ups

input: Can I request a block of Reserve available days greater than six (6) consecutive days?
output: Yes, you can request blocks of Reserve available days greater than six (6) consecutive days, provided that you waive contractual limitations concerning consecutive duty days.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L12 Reserve Moves, Trades and Pick ups

input: As a Reserve flight attendant, can I pick up a Reserve period on my GDO(s) or moveable day(s) following a GDO?
output: Yes, you can request to pick up a Reserve period on your GDO(s) or moveable day(s) following a GDO from Daily Open Time. When doing so, you will be credited above the minimum monthly guarantee for the Reserve period or hours flown during the Reserve period.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L12 Reserve Moves, Trades and Pick ups

input: As a Regular or Relief line holder, can I drop a scheduled trip to a Reserve flight attendant on a GDO or moveable day(s) following a GDO?
output: Yes, you can drop a scheduled trip to a Reserve Flight Attendant on a GDO or moveable day(s) following a GDO in accordance with Section 8.L.11. When doing so, the Reserve Flight Attendant will be credited above the minimum credit guarantee for the trip flown during their day off. The pairing must be scheduled to return to base twelve (12) hours prior to the Reserve Flight Attendant’s next Reserve Period. Additionally, the Reserve Flight Attendant must waive contractual limitations concerning minimum days off and consecutive days on duty.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L12 Reserve Moves, Trades and Pick ups

input: What should I do if the electronic Bidding Tool is inoperative, or is exhibiting signs of performance degradation?
output: If the electronic bidding tool is inoperative or is exhibiting signs of performance degradation, the Company shall use best efforts to award the transactions as soon as possible. The MEC President or designee will be notified whenever the electronic bidding tool is inoperative or is exhibiting signs of performance degradation and the reason therefore.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L13 Electronic Bidding Tool FLICA

input: Can I receive a premium for voluntarily picking up unassigned trips in Open Time on designated days?
output: Yes, you may receive a premium for voluntarily picking up unassigned trips in Open Time on the designated days. This premium may also apply to reserve Flight Attendants who pick up on GDOs or on moveable days following a GDO. The Company will notify the Union of the details of the premium pay pick-up offer(s) for open time and for junior assignment if applicable, at least twenty-four (24) hours prior to publication of the offer(s).

input: What is the minimum premium percentage for picking up unassigned trips during Open Time on designated days?
output: The minimum premium will be two hundred percent (200%) and will apply to all trips in Open Time operating on the designated day(s). To be eligible for the premium, you must pick up the qualifying trip from Open Time and work the trip. A qualifying trip is one that operates on at least one (1) of the days specified in the notice and which is picked up from Open Time within the parameters outlined in the agreement. When the Company publishes the offer of premium Open Time on the specified days, the offer will apply to those qualifying trips picked up after the notice is posted and also to qualifying trips picked up in the two (2) calendar days prior to the notice publication date. The premium will apply to the entire trip for any qualifying trip.

input: What is the premium payment for Company-designated premium flying beyond two calendar days?
output: The Company may, at its discretion, designate open time trips beyond two (2) calendar days as premium flying. All Company designated premium trips will be paid 200% trip credit above guarantee for the trip flown (scheduled or actual whichever is greater). A Flight Attendant is entitled to 200% if they do not operate only in cases of Company-initiated trip removal (e.g., reassignment, reschedule, cancellation). Premium pay for designated trips only applies to trips picked up (adds) in Electronic Shift Bid. It does not apply for trip trades with open time and/or mutual trades.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8L15 Company Designated Premium Flying

input: What is the order of assignment and who is first to be called for Open Time flying?
output: Certainly! The Company follows a specific order of priority when assigning Open Time to flight attendants. First, they consider Time Recoverable Status as described in paragraph N. Then, if there is no suitable candidate from the first step, they move on to Available Reserves as described in Section 9, Reserve (paragraphs 2a and 4). If still unable to find a match, the Company proceeds with Premium Pickup Folder as described in paragraph O., followed by Junior Assignment as described in paragraph P. This order ensures that all possible options are explored before assigning Open Time to flight attendants.

input: As a flight attendant, I was assigned to Time Recoverable Status due to lost time before my check-in for a trip in base during this bid period. What should I expect?
output: You will be notified by Crew Scheduling if the Company believes it may need to reschedule you during your trip hour period. The Company can assign any trip within two hours prior and two hours after the original parameters of your pairing. If removed more than 24 hours in advance, you'll be automatically released from duty a day at a time if not assigned to a new trip by 24 hours before check-in. If removed within 24 hours, you must be rescheduled concurrently and released one day at a time from multi-day pairings.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8N Time Recoverable Status TAJ

input: How will my pay be affected if I'm reassigned to a different trip due to Time Recoverable Status?
output: You will be paid the greater of the credited hours for the original trip or the replacement trip. This ensures you are compensated appropriately for any changes in your schedule.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8N Time Recoverable Status TAJ

input: As a flight attendant, I was assigned to Time Recoverable Status due to lost time before my check-in for a trip in base during this bid period. What should I expect?
output: You will be notified by Crew Scheduling if the Company believes it may need to reschedule you during your trip hour period. The Company can assign any trip within two hours prior and two hours after the original parameters of your pairing. If removed more than 24 hours in advance, you'll be automatically released from duty a day at a time if not assigned to a new trip by 24 hours before check-in. If removed within 24 hours, you must be rescheduled concurrently and released one day at a time from multi-day pairings.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8N Time Recoverable Status TAJ

input: How will my pay be affected if I'm reassigned to a different trip due to Time Recoverable Status?
output: You will be paid the greater of the credited hours for the original trip or the replacement trip. This ensures you are compensated appropriately for any changes in your schedule.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8N Time Recoverable Status TAJ

input: As a flight attendant on Time Recoverable Status, what are my restrictions and responsibilities?
output: While on Time Recoverable Status, you will not be assigned Reserve duties. You must provide Crew Scheduling with your contact information during this period. If contacted, you should return their call before the 24-hour release time. Additionally, you may request to be released from your Time Recoverable period without pay, provided you do so in advance of the automatic release, and with the consent of Crew Scheduling.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8N Time Recoverable Status TAJ

input: What is the purpose of the Premium Pick-Up Folder?
output: The Premium Pick-Up Folder is a designated folder within the electronic shift trade platform that contains trips within two calendar days that have been designated as premium by the Company. These trips are available for pick-up on a first-come, first-served basis up to four hours prior to the trip's report time. The purpose of this folder is to provide Flight Attendants with additional opportunities to pick up premium trips that offer higher pay rates.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8O Premium Pick up Folder

input: Can a Flight Attendant trade a pairing for a Premium Pick-Up Folder Pairing?
output: No, a Flight Attendant cannot trade any pairing for a Premium Pick-Up Folder Pairing. These pairings are available for pick-up only and once awarded, a Flight Attendant cannot drop, trade or swap the Premium Pick-Up Folder Pairing.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8O Premium Pick up Folder

input: What happens if a Flight Attendant picks up a Premium Pick-Up Folder Pairing?
output: If a Flight Attendant picks up and flies a Premium Pick-Up Folder Pairing, they will be paid an additional 100% of trip credit above guarantee for the trip flown (scheduled or actual whichever is greater). This bonus payment is intended to incentivize Flight Attendants to pick up these premium trips and provide them with increased compensation for their efforts.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8O Premium Pick up Folder

input: How long must a Premium Pick-Up Folder Pairing remain in Daily Open Time before it can be picked up by a Flight Attendant from out of domicile?
output: A Premium Pick-Up Folder Pairing must remain in Daily Open Time for a minimum of twenty-four (24) hours without being picked up by a Flight Attendant based where the trip originates before it can be picked up by a Flight Attendant from out of domicile. This waiting period ensures that other Flight Attendants have an opportunity to pick up the pairing before it becomes available for out-of-domicile pickup.

input: Can a flight attendant be junior assigned on their scheduled day off?
output: Yes, a flight attendant can be junior assigned on their scheduled day off if there is a need for additional staffing and all other flight attendants with seniority are unavailable or unable to work. Junior assignment is an option after the order of assignment in paragraph M has been followed.

input: Who can initiate a junior assignment call?
output: Only Crew Scheduling may initiate a junior assignment call. They are responsible for making positive contact with the flight attendant to confirm the assignment.

input: Can a flight attendant confirm a junior assignment through electronic means?
output: Yes, if available, a flight attendant can confirm a junior assignment through electronic means.

input: Is it possible for a flight attendant to be junior assigned because they contacted Crew Scheduling about routine inquiries?
output: No, a flight attendant should not be junior assigned solely because they have contacted Crew Scheduling regarding routine inquiries. Junior assignment is typically reserved for situations where all other available flight attendants with seniority are unavailable or unable to work.

input: When can a flight attendant be junior assigned if it's not an early morning departure?
output: A flight attendant can only be junior assigned on the day of the trip unless it is an early morning departure (prior to 0700 LT). In that case, Crew Scheduling may initiate a junior assignment call after 2000 LT the night before.

input: How many times can a flight attendant be junior assigned in a year?
output: A flight attendant may only be junior assigned once per bid period and up to five times per year. The specific number of times a flight attendant can be junior assigned will depend on their seniority and the availability of other flight attendants.

input: Can a flight attendant be junior assigned for Reserve or Ready Reserve duty?
output: No, a flight attendant may not be junior assigned for Reserve or Ready Reserve duty. Junior assignment is typically reserved for situations where all other available flight attendants with seniority are unavailable or unable to work on a specific trip.

input: Are flight attendants compensated for being junior assigned?
output: Yes, flight attendants who are junior assigned will receive additional compensation according to the provisions outlined in Section 3, Compensation. The specific amount of compensation will depend on various factors such as seniority and trip duration.

input: Are flight attendants compensated for being junior assigned?
output: Yes, flight attendants who are junior assigned will receive additional compensation according to the provisions outlined in Section 3, Compensation. The specific amount of compensation will depend on various factors such as seniority and trip duration.

input: What is the definition of "reroute" in the context of flight attendants and crew scheduling?
output: Reroute refers to a situation where a line holding Flight Attendant is involuntarily assigned to an uncovered segment(s) even though their trip operates. This can occur when there are no available Ready Reserves or Reserve Flight Attendants, and the new assignment must arrive no later than two hours after the lineholder's original trip termination.

input: What is "schedule integrity" in relation to flight attendants?
output: Schedule integrity refers to a lineholder's right to fly their bid trip without being rerouted, provided that the lineholder's trip operates and they are legal to fly it. This principle ensures that flight attendants maintain their planned schedules and minimize disruptions.

input: How many times can a lineholder be rerouted in a pairing per year?
output: A lineholder may be rerouted in a pairing up to eight times per year, but once a reroute has occurred, the schedule integrity language will no longer apply for the remaining duration of the rerouted pairing. This limit can be exceeded with the lineholder's concurrence, and the lineholder will receive 200% pay for that rerouted pairing.

input: What happens to a lineholder's days off when they are rerouted?
output: When a lineholder is rerouted, they shall have an equal number of days off restored pursuant to Paragraph 8.Y. The lineholder will receive pay and credit protection for the trip dropped due to day-off restoration and may be subject to Time Recoverable provisions of paragraph N. of this Section.

input: How are flight attendants notified of a reroute assignment?
output: Crew Scheduling is responsible for initiating reroute calls and must make positive contact with the Flight Attendant to confirm the assignment. Positive contact will be initiated via phone call or through electronic means (e.g., ACARS, electronic notification app, etc.). Upon notification, the Flight Attendant is obligated to confirm receipt of the notification.

input: What happens if a lineholder contacts Crew Scheduling regarding a reroute?
output: A lineholder should not be rerouted because they have contacted Crew Scheduling unless the lineholder was returning a call from Crew Scheduling. This ensures that reroutes are initiated by Crew Scheduling and not influenced by individual flight attendants.

input: How are flight attendants compensated when they are rerouted?
output: Flight attendants who are rerouted will receive 150% of their current hourly rate for any additional pairing credit flown above their original scheduled trip. This compensation aims to acknowledge the inconvenience and extra work associated with being rerouted and helps maintain fairness in the scheduling process.

input: If Crew Scheduling needs to modify my trip due to a schedule disruption, can they reschedule me to deadhead into position to resume my original pairing downline?
output: Yes, if Crew Scheduling must modify your trip due to a schedule disruption, they may reschedule you to deadhead into position to resume your original pairing downline. This is option (a) in the list of possible actions.

input: Can Crew Scheduling reschedule me to operate new segment(s) with my new trip returning to base no later than two hours after my original trip's release time?
output: Yes, if Crew Scheduling must modify your trip due to a schedule disruption, they may also reschedule you to operate new segment(s), with the new trip returning to base no later than two (2) hours after your original trip's release time. This is option (b) in the list of possible actions.

input: Who can initiate rescheduling calls?
output: Only Crew Scheduling may initiate rescheduling calls. They are responsible for making positive contact with you to confirm the assignment. Positive contact will be initiated via phone call or through electronic means (e.g., ACARS, electronic notification app, etc.)

input: What is my obligation when Crew Scheduling contacts me about a schedule change?
output: Upon notification of a schedule change, you are obligated to confirm the notification. You must respond to positive contact made by Crew Scheduling via phone call or through electronic means (e.g., ACARS, electronic notification app, etc.)

input: What provisions apply when I am rescheduled into a duty period on my first scheduled day off?
output:
When you are rescheduled into a duty period on your first scheduled day off, the following provisions apply:
a. You shall be returned to your base and released into rest as early as possible on Spirit flight(s) except as provided in Paragraph b. below. The Flight Attendant may be required to operate no more than two segments. However, the Flight Attendant may elect to perform additional segments if requested by the Company. If you are required to work the segment(s) (versus deadhead) back to base, you will have the option of receiving 200% pay for that rescheduled duty period or shall have an equal number of day(s) off restored off pursuant to Section 8.Y. The Flight Attendant shall receive pay and credit protection for the trip dropped due to day-off restoration. You may be subject to Time Recoverable provisions of paragraph N. of this Section.
b. If there is no Spirit service that would return you to base that day, or if Spirit service would exceed two (2) scheduled segments, other airline flights must be booked for you unless you agree to be scheduled to return to Base on a Spirit flight(s).
c. If you are Rescheduled into a day(s) off and deadheads back to base, you shall have an equal number of day(s) off restored pursuant to Paragraph 8.Y. The Flight Attendant shall receive pay and credit protection for the trip dropped due to day-off restoration. You may be subject to Time Recoverable provisions of paragraph N. of this Section.

input: How will I be compensated if Crew Scheduling reschedules me to fly additional pairing credit above my original scheduled trip?
output: If you are a Line Holding Flight Attendant who is Rescheduled and must fly additional pairing credit above your original scheduled trip, you will be compensated at 150% of your current hourly rate for any additional pairing credit flown.

input: Can I ask for a downline equipment change if there is an aircraft change that requires fewer flight attendants?
output: Yes, you can request a downline equipment change if you are offered the opportunity to be removed from the trip due to an aircraft change that requires fewer flight attendants.

input: What happens if the chaser Flight Attendant(s) are needed to operate downline?
output: If the chaser Flight Attendant(s) are required to operate downline, all flight attendants will remain on the pairing, and the senior chaser Flight Attendant(s) will be offered the opportunity to deadhead on the downgraded flight segment.

input: What is the process if the equipment substitution occurs more than sixty minutes prior to report time?
output: If the equipment substitution occurs more than 60 minutes prior to report time, the affected Flight Attendant will not be required to report to the airport and will be notified of the change.

input: What happens if the chaser Flight Attendants are needed to operate downline?
output: If the chaser Flight Attendants are needed to operate downline, all flight attendants will remain on the pairing, and the senior chaser Flight Attendant(s) will be offered the opportunity to deadhead on the downgraded flight segment.

input: What happens if the chaser Flight Attendants are not required to operate downline?
output: If the chaser Flight Attendants are not needed to operate downline, removal per the terms of paragraph S will be offered to the most senior chaser Flight Attendant.

input: What is the notification process if the equipment substitution occurs more than 60 minutes prior to report time?
output: If the equipment substitution occurs more than 60 minutes prior to report time, the affected Flight Attendant will be notified and will not be required to report to the airport.

input: What if I have a personal emergency during my trip? Can I be removed from the trip for personal reasons?
output: You should inform inflight and crew scheduling as soon as possible so that they can assess the situation and make necessary arrangements. Inflight would be able to guide you as to the next best steps.

input: I’m being removed from my first leg(s). When will I be notified?
output: According to company policy, you should be notified at least two (2) hours prior to the trip’s check-in, or as soon as it is known, whichever is earlier. We understand that this may cause inconvenience and we apologize for any disruption.

input: Can you please check if there are any duplicate assignments in my schedule this month?
output: I’m sorry, but we don’t have any records of duplicate assignments for your schedule this month. However, if you notice any discrepancies or issues with your schedule, please let us know immediately so that we can resolve them as soon as possible.

input: What should I do if there is a duplicate assignment due to a Company error?
output: If there is a duplicate assignment due to a Company error, the more senior Flight Attendant of the two (2) may elect to remain on the trip or be removed, unless the Flight Attendant is required for language or other qualification. The Flight Attendant removed from the trip shall be paid and credited for the scheduled value of the trip. The Flight Attendant is not required to be on Time Recoverable Status.

input: How will I be compensated if I am removed from a duplicate assignment due to a Company error?
output: If you are removed from a duplicate assignment due to a Company error, you shall be paid and credited for the scheduled value of the trip. You will not be required to be on Time Recoverable Status.

input: Can I choose to remain on the trip if there is a duplicate assignment due to a Company error?
output: If there is a duplicate assignment due to a Company error, the more senior Flight Attendant of the two (2) may elect to remain on the trip or be removed. However, if you are required for language or other qualification, you must remain on the trip.

input: What should I do if I am notified of a duplicate assignment after I have already booked and confirmed my schedule?
output: If you are notified of a duplicate assignment after you have already booked and confirmed your schedule, please contact us immediately so that we can resolve the issue as soon as possible. We will work with you to ensure that you are compensated fairly and that any disruptions to your schedule are minimized.

input: How can I check if there are any duplicate assignments in my schedule?
output: You can check your schedule on our website or through the crew scheduling system to see if there are any duplicate assignments. If you notice any discrepancies or issues with your schedule, please let us know immediately so that we can resolve them as soon as possible.

input: Are all conversations between Crew Scheduling and Flight Attendants recorded?
output: Yes, all conversations between Crew Scheduling personnel and Flight Attendants conducted over recorded Company telephone lines are recorded. The recordings will be kept by the Company for a minimum of ninety (90) days. In the event of a dispute, the Union is entitled to listen to and receive a copy of the conversation.

input: What happens if there is no recording available in case of a dispute?
output: If there is no recording available in case of a dispute, the issue will be resolved in favor of the Flight Attendant. The recordings are not randomly reviewed for the purpose of discovering violations, but may be reviewed to promote professionalism and courtesy. A Flight Attendant will not be subject to discipline based on a random review for professionalism and courtesy.

input: Can I request a copy of a recorded conversation?
output: Yes, if you are a Flight Attendant and there is a dispute, the Union is entitled to listen to and receive a copy of the conversation. You may also request a copy of the recording from the Company.

input: How long are the recordings kept by the Company?
output: The recordings will be kept by the Company for a minimum of ninety (90) days.

input: Are there any exceptions to the recording policy?
output: No, all conversations between Crew Scheduling and Flight Attendants conducted over recorded Company telephone lines are recorded, except in cases where electronic recording is implemented on other telephone lines, in which case the governing provisions will be agreed upon by the Company and the Union.

input: What does it mean to be pay protected for all errors other than typographical errors?
output: Being pay protected means that a Flight Attendant will receive pay for all errors other than typographical errors made by the Company in their schedule or assignments. This includes any mistakes, such as incorrect dates, times, or destinations.

input: How long does the Company have to post corrections?
output: The Company retains the right within forty-eight (48) hours of the publishing of the bid package to post corrections. After this period, the schedule and assignments will be considered final and no further changes will be made.

input: How are corrections posted by the Company?
output: Corrections are posted in the same manner as the Initial and Final Bid Awards. This means that they will be communicated to Flight Attendants through the crew scheduling system or other appropriate channels, such as email or phone.

input: Can I request a correction if I notice an error in my schedule?
output: Yes, you can request a correction if you notice an error in your schedule. However, please note that the Company retains the right to post corrections within forty-eight (48) hours of the publishing of the bid package and may not make further changes after this period.

input: Can I redeem my Day Off Restoration (DOR) on a Holiday Weekend or Critical Day?
output: No, DORs cannot be redeemed on Holiday Weekends or Critical Days. You can opt to forego the replacement day off and receive 4 hours of pay above guarantee.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8Y Day Off Restoration DOR

input: What are the restrictions for redeeming a DOR in the current bid period?
output: DORs must be redeemed in the current bid period if possible. If no eligible trips or reserve days are available, you can redeem the DOR in the next bid period with Crew Scheduling concurrence.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8Y Day Off Restoration DOR

input: Can I use my DOR to split a trip?
output: Yes, DORs can be used to split a trip if all days of the trip comply with the restrictions mentioned earlier.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8Y Day Off Restoration DOR

input: How should I redeem DORs when splitting a trip?
output: When using DORs to split a trip, they must be combined and redeemed consecutively from the outside-in and cannot be used in the middle of the trip.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8Y Day Off Restoration DOR

input: Do I get a DOR if my trip releases before 0200?
output: No, you would not be elligable for a DOR if the trip releases directly at 0200 or anytime before. This would be considered to have released the previous calendar day.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 8Y Day Off Restoration DOR

input: Can you confirm that all reserve lines have a minimum of twelve (12) days off in base in any 30-day bid period?
output: Yes, all reserve lines must contain a minimum of twelve (12) days off in base in any 30-day bid period.

input: How are immoveable days off scheduled, and what does it mean for Reserve Flight Attendants?
output: Immoveable days off are scheduled in two (2) blocks of four (4) days each, with four (4) consecutive days designated by the Flight Attendant and four (4) by the Company. These days are non-working, non-moveable, and exempt from assignment. Reserve Flight Attendants will not be involuntarily scheduled or assigned to any flying on their immoveable days off, except for those assignments made pursuant to Junior Assignment provisions.

input: What are the requirements for moveable days off?
output: All remaining days off are moveable. There shall be no less than two (2) scheduled consecutive moveable days off in a block of days off. If Crew Scheduling intends to move a Reserve Flight Attendant’s moveable days off, they will notify the Flight Attendant of the change prior to the end of the Reserve assignment block before the move.

input: What happens when a flight to which a Reserve Flight Attendant is assigned returns to the base after the start of a day off?
output: The Flight Attendant shall be released and eligible for an additional day off, subject to the restrictions outlined in Section 7.D.3.

input: What are the requirements for the additional day off if Crew Scheduling moves a Reserve Flight Attendant’s moveable day off?
output: The new day off must meet the following requirements: be placed at the beginning or end of an existing block of Reserve days during the remainder of the month if possible, or the next month; not be placed on a day below minimum reserve coverage; not be placed on a designated holiday weekend; not be placed on Critical Days; if possible, moveable day(s) must be redeemed in the current bid period; moveable days may be redeemed for the current or the next day’s operation with Crew Scheduling concurrence; the Flight Attendant may opt to forego the replacement day off and receive four (4) hours of pay above guarantee; day(s) restored in the next month shall not count toward that month’s minimum days off.

input: What happens when a Reserve Flight Attendant accepts any assignment on their day off?
output: The Reserve Flight Attendant will be credited for the credited hours of the assignment, in addition to the monthly guarantee.

input: Can you confirm that there will be eight (8) immoveable days off scheduled in two (2) blocks of four (4) days each?
output: Yes, there shall be eight (8) immoveable days off scheduled in two (2) blocks of four (4) days each.

input: What does it mean for a Reserve Flight Attendant to have immoveable days off?
output: Immoveable days off are non-working, non-moveable, and exempt from assignment. The Flight Attendant will not be involuntarily scheduled, rescheduled, or assigned to any flying that would cause them to be away from base on their immoveable days off, except for those assignments made pursuant to Junior Assignment provisions set forth in Section 8.P.

input: Can Reserve Flight Attendants designate which days will be immoveable?
output: Yes, four (4) consecutive days shall be designated by the Flight Attendant and four (4) consecutive days will be designated by the Company as immoveable prior to the posting of the Final Schedule. These days will be designated as Guaranteed Days Off (GDO).

input: Are Reserve Flight Attendants allowed to have immoveable days off during their transition period?
output: No, Reserve Flight Attendants are not allowed to designate any of their days off as immoveable during the transition period.

input: What are the requirements for the additional day off if Crew Scheduling moves a Reserve Flight Attendant’s moveable day off?
output: The new day off must meet the following requirements: be placed at the beginning or end of an existing block of Reserve days during the remainder of the month if possible, or the next month; not be placed on a day below minimum reserve coverage; not be placed on a designated holiday weekend; not be placed on Critical Days; if possible, moveable day(s) must be redeemed in the current bid period; moveable days may be redeemed for the current or the next day’s operation with Crew Scheduling concurrence; the Flight Attendant may opt to forego the replacement day off and receive four (4) hours of pay above guarantee; day(s) restored in the next month shall not count toward that month’s minimum days off.

input: Can a Reserve Flight Attendant choose their own replacement day off if Crew Scheduling moves their moveable day off?
output: Yes, the Flight Attendant will have the opportunity to choose their replacement day off, subject to the requirements outlined in the question.

input: Is it possible for a Reserve Flight Attendant to redeem their moveable days off in the next bid period if no eligible reserve days are available in the current bid period?
output: Yes, if no eligible reserve days are available in the current bid period, the Flight Attendant will be permitted to redeem the moveable day(s) in the next bid period.

input: What happens if a Reserve Flight Attendant opts to forego their replacement day off and receive four (4) hours of pay above guarantee?
output: If a Reserve Flight Attendant opts to forego their replacement day off, they will receive four (4) hours of pay above the monthly guarantee.

input: What are the reserve days for my current period?
output: The Reserve Flight Attendant may be assigned to perform duty between 0001 LT on the first day of their Reserve period and ending at 2400 LT on the last day of their Reserve period.

input: When does my on-duty period for reserve start?
output: Reserve on-duty periods for purposes of duty limitations shall start at the check-in time.

input: What should I do after completing an assignment at my base?
output: Upon completion of an assignment at the Flight Attendant’s base, a Reserve Flight Attendant shall contact Crew Scheduling before departing the airport. The Union and Company agree to discuss alternative methods of positive contact.

input: What happens if I still have duty time available after contacting Crew Scheduling?
output: If the Flight Attendant still has duty time available, they may be required to wait at the airport for further assignment for no more than one (1) hour and may only be assigned to a new trip that is scheduled to depart within two (2) hours of the block-in time of the earlier trip in accordance with Section 9.D.4 Reserve Assignment, except that 9.D.4. Reserve Assignment will not apply if the assignment was due to a Late Sick Call (LSK), No Show (NSH), or occurs during a declared ADP 3.

input: What happens if Crew Scheduling releases me?
output: If Crew Scheduling releases the Flight Attendant, they shall be free from all duty and receive in base rest pursuant to Section 7.A.1. until the Flight Attendant’s next scheduled Reserve Shift.

input: What happens if I am released from duty during my next notification period?
output: If Crew Scheduling releases the Flight Attendant, they shall be free from all duty and receive in base rest pursuant to Section 7.A.1 until the Flight Attendant’s next notification period. If the rest period conflicts with the Flight Attendant’s next notification period, the Flight Attendant will be assigned to the notification period following the Flight Attendant’s originally scheduled notification period. The Flight Attendant will continue on the newly assigned notification period for the duration of the current block of reserve days.

input: Can I be assigned to a trip that operates subsequent to in base rest?
output: Crew Scheduling may assign the Flight Attendant to a trip that operates subsequent to in base rest irrespective of the Flight Attendant’s next assigned Reserve Shift.

input: What are the five (5) shifts of reserve availability for notification?
output:
RVA Reserve A: Available for notification from 0001 to 1000.
RVB Reserve B: Available for notification from 0401 to 1400.
RVC Reserve C: Available for notification from 0701 to 1700.
RVD Reserve D: Available for notification from 1101 to 2100.
 RVE Reserve E: Available for notification from 1401 to 2400.

input: How is a reserve shift defined for pay purposes?
output: A Reserve Shift shall be considered one (1) day of work for pay purposes.

input: How are flight attendants notified about their reserve shifts?
output: Flight Attendants will bid Reserve Shifts published on the monthly bid package. All awards are protected and may not be changed without the concurrence of the Flight Attendant.

input: What is the duty of a reserve flight attendant during assigned shift periods?
output: Reserve Flight Attendants must be available for notification in accordance with paragraph E. below during assigned Shift periods. However, the duty to which the Reserve assigned is not required to commence within the assigned Shift period.

input: What are the conditions under which a crew scheduling may move a flight attendant to a reserve shift?
output:
Crew Scheduling may move a Flight Attendant to a Reserve Shift immediately preceding or following the Flight Attendant’s originally assigned Reserve Shift within a calendar day subject to the following conditions:
    a. Crew Scheduling has exhausted all Reserve Flight Attendants scheduled to be available for notification during the preceding or following Shift.
    b. If the Flight Attendant moved to the preceding or following Reserve Shift does not receive an assignment during that Shift, the Flight Attendant shall revert to originally scheduled Reserve Shift periods for all subsequent Reserve available 9-4 days in the month.
    c. Flight Attendants shall be moved to preceding or following Reserve Shifts in order of total credited hours accrued for the month. Flight Attendants with low credited time will be moved first.
    d. No Flight Attendant shall be moved to a preceding or following Reserve Shift more than two (2) times during a monthly bid period.
    e. The Company may not move the first notification period of Flight Attendant’s block of Reserve days.
    f. The Flight Attendant shall be notified that their Reserve Shift has been moved prior to the day on which the original Reserve Shift was scheduled to commence.

input: What are the five (5) shifts of reserve availability for notification?
output:
RVA Reserve A: Available for notification from 0001 to 1000.
RVB Reserve B: Available for notification from 0401 to 1400.
RVC Reserve C: Available for notification from 0701 to 1700.
RVD Reserve D: Available for notification from 1101 to 2100.
RVE Reserve E: Available for notification from 1401 to 2400.

input: How is a reserve shift defined for pay purposes?
output: A Reserve Shift shall be considered one (1) day of work for pay purposes.

input: How are flight attendants notified about their reserve shifts?
output: Flight Attendants will bid Reserve Shifts published on the monthly bid package. All awards are protected and may not be changed without the concurrence of the Flight Attendant.

input: What is the duty of a reserve flight attendant during assigned shift periods?
output: Reserve Flight Attendants must be available for notification in accordance with paragraph E. below during assigned Shift periods. However, the duty to which the Reserve assigned is not required to commence within the assigned Shift period.

input: Can I ask about the possibility of being moved to a different shift?
output: Yes, you can inquire about any changes to your schedule or assignment. We will do our best to accommodate your needs while adhering to company policies and procedures.

input: How are crew scheduling decisions made for flight attendants?
output: Crew scheduling decisions are based on a variety of factors, including staffing needs, aircraft availability, and regulatory requirements. We aim to create schedules that are fair, efficient, and comply with all relevant regulations.

input: What happens if there are no reserve flight attendants available during my shift?
output: If no reserve flight attendants are available during your shift, you may be moved to a different shift subject to certain conditions. This decision will be made by the crew scheduler based on company policies and procedures.

input: Can I be moved to a different shift more than two times in a monthly bidding period?
output: No, there is a limit of two shift changes per monthly bidding period to ensure fairness and consistency in crew scheduling.

input: How will I be notified if my reserve shift has been moved?
output: You will be notified of any changes to your schedule before the original shift was scheduled to commence. We will make every effort to inform you as soon as possible, and in accordance with company policies and procedures.

input: What happens if I am moved to a different shift but do not receive an assignment during that shift?
output: If you are moved to a different shift but do not receive an assignment, you will revert back to your originally scheduled reserve shift periods for all subsequent available 9-4 days in the month.

input: How are flight attendants prioritized when being considered for shift changes?
output: Flight attendants are prioritized based on their total credited hours accrued for the month, with those who have more experience being given preference first. However, no flight attendant will be moved to a preceding or following reserve shift more than two times during a monthly bid period.

input: How many days should a Reserve Flight Attendant be assigned during their Reserve Shift period?
output: A Reserve Flight Attendant may be assigned during their Reserve Shift period to a trip or Ready Reserve assignment no earlier than 0001 ET two (2) days prior to the day of the trip’s check-in time or the start of Ready Reserve assignment in accordance with Section 8.M.

input: What is the maximum duty time for a flight attendant before being moved to the next Reserve Shift period?
output: If the duty time of the trip (prior to the first ensuing rest period) to be assigned plus the amount of time already passed from the commencement of the contact period exceeds sixteen (16) hours, the Crew Scheduler may move to the next Reserve Shift period.

input: How are Reserve Flight Attendants placed in availability buckets?
output: A Reserve Flight Attendant will be placed in a one (1), two (2), three (3), four (4), five (5) or six (6) day availability bucket based on the number of reserve shifts prior to the Flight Attendant’s next scheduled day off.

input: How are Reserve Flight Attendants assigned within each group?
output: Within each group, rank those Flight Attendants electing to be called first, senior to junior, followed by the remaining Flight Attendants, junior to senior. A Flight Attendant on reserve shall be assigned a pairing in the order of their placement within the applicable reserve category.

input: What happens when there is no Flight Attendant available in a particular availability bucket?
output: When there are no Flight Attendants available in a bucket, a Flight Attendant in the next larger availability bucket will be assigned or the trip may be split and assigned to a Reserve Flight Attendant in a smaller bucket.

input: What is the purpose of making Reserve availability/Bucket information electronically available to Flight Attendants?
output: The Company shall make Reserve availability/Bucket information electronically available to the Flight Attendants, in real time. The information shall contain the names of reserve Flight Attendants with employee and seniority numbers, current notification period, projected credit for the bid month and number of days available.

input: How are Reserve assignments and utilization documented?
output: Reserve assignments and utilization will be documented by the Company and made available upon request to Flight Attendants and Union representatives.

input: Can I be assigned during my reserve shift period to a trip or ready reserve assignment no earlier than two days prior to the check-in time?
output: Yes, you can be assigned during your reserve shift period to a trip or ready reserve assignment no earlier than two days prior to the check-in time.

input: How does crew scheduling consider the contact period when assigning a trip?
output: Crew Scheduling considers the contact period when assigning a trip by ensuring that the duty time of the trip (prior to the first ensuing rest period) plus the amount of time already passed from the commencement of the contact period does not exceed sixteen (16) hours. If it does, the Crew Scheduler may move to the next Reserve Shift period to avoid safety concerns due to lengthy duty times.

input: What happens if the duty time of the trip plus the amount of time already passed from the commencement of the contact period exceeds sixteen (16) hours?
output: If the duty time of the trip plus the amount of time already passed from the commencement of the contact period exceeds sixteen (16) hours, the Crew Scheduler may move to the next Reserve Shift period to avoid safety concerns due to lengthy duty times.

input: Is there a requirement for assigning a Flight Attendant at the end of an earlier Reserve Shift when such trip can be better assigned to a Flight Attendant in the next Reserve Shift period?
output: Yes, there is a requirement for assigning a Flight Attendant at the end of an earlier Reserve Shift when such trip can be better assigned to a Flight Attendant in the next Reserve Shift period to eliminate concerns of safety due to length of time already available.

input: What happens if the Company does not meet with the union scheduling committee at its request to discuss the application of this provision?
output: If the Company does not meet with the union scheduling committee at its request to discuss the application of this provision, it may result in a violation of the collective bargaining agreement.

input: How many days of availability are there for reserve flight attendants?
output: There are one (1), two (2), three (3), four (4), five (5) or six (6) day availability buckets for reserve flight attendants.

input: What is the methodology for assigning reserve flight attendants to pairings?
output: Reserve Flight Attendants will be placed in a one, two, three, four, five or six day availability bucket based on the number of reserve shifts prior to their next scheduled day off. They will be assigned a pairing in the order of their placement within the applicable reserve category, with the highest ranked Flight Attendant being assigned first. If there is no Flight Attendant available in the applicable category, Crew Scheduling will assign a Flight Attendant from the next highest applicable category.

input: Can a pairing be split to utilize Flight Attendants in a smaller reserve bucket?
output: Yes, a pairing can be split and assigned to Reserve Flight Attendants in a smaller availability bucket.

input: What happens when there are no Flight Attendants available in a particular reserve bucket?
output: When there are no Flight Attendants available in a particular reserve bucket, a Flight Attendant from the next larger availability bucket will be assigned or the trip may be split and assigned to a Reserve Flight Attendant in a smaller bucket.

input: How is the ranking of Flight Attendants determined for reserve assignments?
output: The ranking of Flight Attendants for reserve assignments is based on the number of reserve shifts prior to their next scheduled day off, with those electing to be called first being ranked senior to junior, followed by the remaining Flight Attendants, junior to senior.

input: Can you please provide me with the contact information for Crew Scheduling?
output: The contact information for Crew Scheduling is [insert contact details]. Please ensure that all Reserve Flight Attendants provide their contact information to Crew Scheduling in accordance with Section 7.G.

input: I receive a call from Crew Scheduling. What should I do?
output: If you receive a call from Crew Scheduling, please contact them immediately. Flight Attendants on Reserve must return a call to Crew Scheduling within fifteen (15) minutes of the message.

input: Can you confirm if I will have at least two hours’ notice before being required to report to the crew room for trip assignment?
output: Yes, according to Section 3 of our policies, Reserve Flight Attendants will be given a minimum of two (2) hours’ notice to report to the crew room for trip assignment.

input: I was contacted for a trip that is scheduled to depart in less than two hours. Can I get reimbursement for using short-term parking facilities?
output: Yes, if you were contacted for a trip that is scheduled to depart in two (2) hours or less and Crew Scheduling authorizes it, you may be eligible for reimbursement for the use of short-term parking facilities. Please note that crew room check-in requirements may also be waived under these circumstances. Reimbursement will be provided within ten (10) days following submission of receipts.

input: What are the rules for assigning Ready Reserve periods?
output: Crew Scheduling will assign Ready Reserve periods in five (5) hour increments, and starting times for each period will be determined by the Company. A Reserve Flight Attendant may be assigned to only one (1) Ready Reserve period per calendar day.

input: How many Reserve Flight Attendants are exempt from Ready Reserve assignment during each monthly bid period?
output: Twenty percent (20%) of all Reserve Flight Attendants in a base with more than 100 Flight Attendants will be exempt, and 10% of those in a base with fewer than 100 Flight Attendants will be exempt.

input: Are Ready Reserve periods considered on-duty time for pay and duty limitations?
output: Yes, Ready Reserve periods are considered on-duty time for both purposes. The duty period commences at the start of the Ready Reserve period.

input: Can a Flight Attendant be assigned a pairing or flight after their Ready Reserve period has ended?
output: Yes, if the pairing or flight is scheduled to depart within two (2) hours of the end of the Ready Reserve period.

input: What should a Ready Reserve Flight Attendant do upon completion of their assignment at their base?
output: The Flight Attendant should contact Crew Scheduling before departing the airport. If released, they will be free from duty and receive in-base rest. Otherwise, they may be assigned a pairing or flight that departs within two (2) hours of the end of their Ready Reserve period.

input: How are Reserve Flight Attendants assigned to Ready Reserve during their availability Shift?
output: Available Reserve Flight Attendants who prefer Ready Reserve assignment will be contacted first. If no preferences are indicated, the assignment will go to the available Reserve with the lowest seniority.

input: What are the requirements for Ready Reserve Flight Attendants regarding availability and readiness?
output: Ready Reserve Flight Attendants must be available in the crew room and report within 15 minutes of notification, ready to depart within 45 minutes.

input: How are assignments made when there are two (2) Flight Attendants on Ready Reserve during the same Shift?
output: Assignments will be made according to the rules outlined in Section D.4. of the contract.

input: Are Ready Reserve Flight Attendants allowed to be assigned Reserve out of base?
output: No, a Ready Reserve Flight Attendant shall not be assigned Reserve out of base as described in paragraph G. below.

input: Can you confirm the starting time for my ready reserve period tomorrow?
output: The starting time for your ready reserve period tomorrow is 8:00 AM.

input: I noticed I’m exempt from Ready Reserve assignment this month. Can you explain why?
output: According to our records, 20% of all Reserve Flight Attendants in a base with more than 100 Flight Attendants are exempt from Ready Reserve assignment during each monthly bid period.

input: Can I be assigned to another ready reserve period if my current one ends early?
output: No, you can only be assigned to one Ready Reserve period per calendar day. However, if your current period ends early and there is no further assignment for the day, you will be considered released from duty.

input: What are the rules regarding being assigned a pairing or flight after my ready reserve period ends?
