output: You may be assigned a pairing or flight which departs after the Ready Reserve period has ended, provided that the pairing or flight is scheduled to depart within two (2) hours of the end of the Ready Reserve period.

input: How long do I need to wait after my Ready Reserve period ends before I can be assigned a pairing or flight?
output: You may be assigned a pairing or flight which departs after the Ready Reserve period has ended, provided that the pairing or flight is scheduled to depart within two (2) hours of the end of the Ready Reserve period.

input: What happens if Crew Scheduling releases me during my Ready Reserve assignment?
output: If Crew Scheduling releases you during your Ready Reserve assignment, you will be free from all duty and receive in-base rest pursuant to Section 7.A.1.

input: How are Reserve Flight Attendants assigned to Ready Reserve assignments?
output: Available Reserve Flight Attendants who indicated on their bid request forms a preference for Ready Reserve assignment will be contacted first. If no available Reserve Flight Attendants indicated a preference, the assignment will be given to the available Reserve(s) with the lowest seniority.

input: How long do I have to report and be ready to depart after being notified of my Ready Reserve assignment?
output: You shall report within fifteen (15) minutes upon notification of assignment and be ready to depart within forty-five (45) minutes.

input: How long can a flight attendant on reserve status be assigned to reserve out of base?
output: A flight attendant on reserve status may be assigned to reserve out of base for a period not to exceed five (5) days, including positioning or deadheading flights.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 9G Reserve Out of Base ROOB

input: Who determines the starting time(s) for ten (10) hour Reserve out of base availability Shifts?
output: Crew scheduling will determine the starting time(s) for ten (10) hour Reserve out of base availability shifts.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 9G Reserve Out of Base ROOB

input: What is provided to a flight attendant who is assigned to reserve out of base?
output: A flight attendant who is assigned to reserve out of base shall be provided a hotel room and per diem for the entire time out of base.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 9G Reserve Out of Base ROOB

input: Are there any restrictions on assigning duty to a flight attendant on reserve out of base?
output: Yes, a flight attendant who is assigned to reserve out of base shall not be assigned duty which would prevent the Flight Attendant from being released at the Flight Attendant’s home base prior to midnight on the fifth (5th) day.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 9G Reserve Out of Base ROOB

input: Where can I be sent to sit reserve out of base?
output: This is determined by crew scheduling and what the company needs for additional coverage. It may be a base or a spirit city such as EWR or BOS.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 9G Reserve Out of Base ROOB

input: Can I request to move my days off as a Reserve Flight Attendant?
output: Yes, you can request to move your days off as a Reserve Flight Attendant in accordance with Section 9.H of the contract.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 9H Reserve Day Moves, Trades and Pick ups

input: Is it possible for me to trade days off with other Reserve Flight Attendants?
output: Yes, you can trade days off with other Reserve Flight Attendants using the Company-provided electronic means (“electronic trade board”) per Section 8.L.11 and Section 8.L.12.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 9H Reserve Day Moves, Trades and Pick ups

input: Can I pick up a Reserve period from Daily Open Time?
output: Yes, you can pick up a Reserve period from Daily Open Time in accordance with Section 8.L of the contract.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 9H Reserve Day Moves, Trades and Pick ups

input: How can I request to pick up a Reserve period on my GDO or moveable days immediately following a GDO?
output: You can request to pick up a Reserve period on your GDO or moveable days immediately following a GDO from Daily Open Time, and requests will be awarded in seniority order. The Reserve Flight Attendant will be credited above the minimum monthly guarantee for the Reserve period or hours flown during the Flight Attendant’s day off.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 9H Reserve Day Moves, Trades and Pick ups

input: What are the parameters for picking up a Reserve period?
output: There are several parameters to comply with when picking up a Reserve period, including: a. The pairing must be scheduled to return to base twelve (12) hours prior to the Flight Attendant’s next Reserve Period. b. The Flight Attendant must waive contractual limitations concerning minimum days off and consecutive days on duty. c. A Reserve may only drop a Reserve period(s) at the beginning or end of a consecutive block of reserve periods to another Flight Attendant. d. Requests to move days off are dependent upon adequate Reserve coverage in that base. e. All days involved in a move request must be in the same bid period, and the move must not interfere with assigned trips or other Company assignments.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 9H Reserve Day Moves, Trades and Pick ups

input: Can I pick up an extra trip on my GDO?
output: Yes, you can pick up an extra trip on your GDO. However, please note that the pairing must be scheduled to return to base twelve (12) hours prior to your next Reserve Period and you will need to waive contractual limitations concerning minimum days off and consecutive days on duty.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 9H Reserve Day Moves, Trades and Pick ups

input: I’m interested in picking up a trip on a moveable day, but it would create a block of six consecutive days on reserve. Can I still do that?
output: Yes, you can pick up the trip on the moveable day, but please note that this will result in a block of more than six (6) consecutive days on reserve and you will need to waive contractual limitations concerning consecutive days on duty.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 9H Reserve Day Moves, Trades and Pick ups

input: I’d like to drop a Reserve period(s) at the end of my block of reserve periods. Can I do that?
output: Yes, you can drop a Reserve period(s) at the end of your block of reserve periods to another Flight Attendant, provided there is adequate Reserve coverage in your base and the move does not interfere with assigned trips or other Company assignments. Please note that all days involved in the move request must be in the same bid period.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 9H Reserve Day Moves, Trades and Pick ups

input: Can I pick up a trip on my GDO even if it means working more than six consecutive days on reserve?
output: No, you cannot pick up a trip on your GDO if it means working more than six (6) consecutive days on reserve. You will need to wait until the block of reserve periods is less than six (6) consecutive days before picking up an extra trip.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 9H Reserve Day Moves, Trades and Pick ups

input: Can I have a pairing on GDOs?
output: Yes, you can have a pairing on GDOs. However, please note that the pairing must be scheduled to return to base twelve (12) hours prior to your next Reserve Period. Additionally, you will need to waive contractual limitations concerning minimum days off and consecutive days on duty.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 9H Reserve Day Moves, Trades and Pick ups

input: Can I drop a Reserve day next week?
output: Yes, you can request to drop a Reserve day with Crew Scheduling’s permission. Please note that your monthly guarantee will be reduced by the number of credited hours of the Reserve Day(s) dropped.

input: How many hours are credited for a Reserve day?
output: Typically, a Reserve day is 8 hours long, but it may vary depending on the specific operational needs and requirements.

input: What happens to my monthly guarantee if I drop multiple Reserve days?
output: Your monthly guarantee will be reduced by the total number of credited hours for all the Reserve days dropped. Keep in mind that dropping too many Reserve days may affect your availability for future assignments.

input: Can I drop a Reserve day if I have already reached my monthly guarantee?
output: No, you cannot drop a Reserve day once you’ve reached your monthly guarantee. The monthly guarantee serves as a cap on the number of hours you can work during that month.

input: Is there any way to make up for lost hours if I drop a Reserve day?
output: You may be able to make up for lost hours by working additional days or shifts outside your monthly guarantee, depending on operational needs and availability. However, this is not guaranteed and subject to approval by Crew Scheduling.

input: I’m feeling unwell and need to report for sick leave. What should I do?
output: Please contact Crew Scheduling as soon as possible to request sick leave.

input: What are the reporting requirements when I’m on Reserve duty at a co-terminal base?
output: If a co-terminal base is established, one of the airports will be designated as your primary airport, and you will need to follow the notification and reporting requirements based on that location.

input: Can I be released from Reserve duty if I’m not feeling well?
output: Yes, you can call crew scheduling or access crew scheduling BOT to be coded sick.

input: How can I access the reserve utilization reports?
output: Reserve utilization reports will be accessible to the MEC President or designee through remote access to the Company’s scheduling software.

input: When do the Company and Union meet to discuss reserve coverage?
output: The Company and the Union will meet on a semi-annual basis to discuss reserve coverage.

input: What is the policy for publishing mandatory general Company training and meetings?
output: All mandatory general Company training and meetings that will be conducted inperson shall be published in the bid package two (2) bid periods prior to the bid period in which the training is scheduled to occur.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 10A Training and Meeting Schedules

input: Is a Flight Attendant required to pay for training required by the Company?
output: No, a Flight Attendant shall not be required to pay for training required by the Company.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 10A Training and Meeting Schedules

input: Must a Flight Attendant interrupt vacation or leave of absence to participate in training?
output: No, a Flight Attendant shall not be required to interrupt vacation or leave of absence to participate in training.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 10A Training and Meeting Schedules

input: In what circumstances may a Flight Attendant participate in training onboard any flight other than those being utilized for revenue flights, ferry flights, dedicated Flight Attendant training flights, or as otherwise permitted by law?
output: A Flight Attendant shall not participate in training onboard any flight other than those being utilized for revenue flights, ferry flights, dedicated Flight Attendant training flights, or as otherwise permitted by law.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 10A Training and Meeting Schedules

input: What is the policy for publishing recurrent training and other Company-required in-person training dates?
output: Recurrent training, and any other Company-required in-person training, dates shall be published in the bid package two (2) bid periods prior to the bid period in which the training is scheduled to occur. Crew Resources shall publish a report in the monthly bid package which identifies those required and/or eligible to attend training. Each bid packet shall generally contain at least two (2) training classes per bid month from which a Flight Attendant will be assigned to attend.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 10A Training and Meeting Schedules

input: What are the rules for requesting a change in training date?
output: A Flight Attendant shall be assigned to another scheduled class within the same bid month upon submission of a request to the designated Crew Training Scheduler provided there is space available in the desired class, it does not expand the Flight Attendant’s training footprint (e.g., increase the number of duty days) and it does not result in any scheduling conflicts or legality issues. If the flight attendant’s request to change their training date has already been granted twice, and a third change has been requested, the third change (and any subsequent requests) will be at the Company’s discretion. A Flight Attendant shall also be assigned to another scheduled class in the month prior to the Flight Attendant’s due month upon submission of a request to the designated Crew Training Scheduler provided there is space available in the desired class, and the change does not expand the Flight Attendant’s training footprint (e.g., increase the number of duty days) and it does not result in any scheduling conflicts or legality issues.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 10A Training and Meeting Schedules

input: Is the Company implementing automation for Flight Attendant training date trading?
output: The Company will use best efforts to implement automation of Flight Attendant training date trading if such automation is available and feasible. Upon implementation of automation pursuant to this paragraph, the Company will permit Flight Attendants to trade training dates for in-person training with another Flight Attendant subject to certain conditions.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 10A Training and Meeting Schedules

input: What are the rules for classroom training hours?
output: Classroom training shall not exceed eight and one-half (8-1/2) hours per day, excluding meal and break periods, nor be scheduled between 2200 LT and 0600 LT. Should circumstances occur that require an exception to the above, the Company shall confer with the MEC President or designee.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 10A Training and Meeting Schedules

input: What happens if assigning a Flight Attendant to training causes them to receive fewer than the minimum days off for the bid period?
output: If after the final award, the assigning a Flight Attendant to training causes the Flight Attendant to receive fewer than the minimum days off for the bid period, the day off will be restored in accordance with Section 8.Y.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 10A Training and Meeting Schedules

input: Can I have a deadhead back to base after completing my training?
output: Yes, you can request a deadhead back to base if your training is completed.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 10A Training and Meeting Schedules

input: What happens if I fail to complete my scheduled training class?
output: If you fail to complete the training class, the Company will place you on inactive unpaid status until you successfully complete the next available training class.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 10A Training and Meeting Schedules

input: Is there a limit to how much training can be scheduled in a day?
output: Yes, training should not exceed the equivalent of the scheduled maximum duty day.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 10A Training and Meeting Schedules

input: Can I waive the provision that limits training scheduling?
output: Yes, you may waive this provision and request to deadhead back to base after completing your training.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 10A Training and Meeting Schedules

input: What happens if I attend a training class but don’t complete it?
output: If you attend but fail to complete your scheduled training class, the Company will place you on inactive unpaid status until you successfully complete the next available training class.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 10A Training and Meeting Schedules

input: What are the hotel accommodations provided for flight attendants during required training out of base?
output: The company provides hotel accommodations for all required training out of base when necessary.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 10B Hotel, Travel and Pay for Training

input: How is per diem provided for training?
output: Per diem is provided for training in accordance with Section 4, Expenses.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 10B Hotel, Travel and Pay for Training

input: What is the provision for positive must-ride space for travel to and from scheduled training?
output: The company provides positive must-ride space for travel to and from scheduled training.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 10B Hotel, Travel and Pay for Training

input: How are lineholders paid for training or missed flight credit hours within the training period?
output: A lineholder shall be paid four (4) hour credit hours per training day or scheduled flight credit hours missed within the training period.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 10B Hotel, Travel and Pay for Training

input: How is a Reserve Flight Attendant paid for travel and/or training on a Reserve duty day during required training?
output: A Reserve Flight Attendant required to attend, or travel to or from training on a Reserve duty day shall be paid four (4) credit hours for each day of travel and/or training to be applied toward the minimum monthly guarantee.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 10B Hotel, Travel and Pay for Training

input: How is a Flight Attendant paid for travel to or from training on a scheduled day off?
output: A Flight Attendant required to travel to or from training on a scheduled day off shall be paid four (4) credit hours in addition to the minimum monthly guarantee.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 10B Hotel, Travel and Pay for Training

input: How is a Flight Attendant paid when assigned to training on their day off?
output: A Flight Attendant assigned to training on their day off shall receive four (4) credit hours in addition to the minimum monthly guarantee.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 10B Hotel, Travel and Pay for Training

input: How are flight attendants paid for Company-mandated computer-based training that is not related to recurrent or requalification training and that does not require the Flight Attendant to complete the training on Company property?
output: A Flight Attendant will be paid one-half (.5) credit hour per hour of course time with a minimum of one (1) credit hour for any Company-mandated computer-based training that is not related to recurrent or requalification training and that does not require the Flight Attendant to complete the training on Company property. Course time will be determined by the Company.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 10B Hotel, Travel and Pay for Training

input: Can a training instructor bid for a line of flying?
output: No, a training instructor shall not bid for a line of flying while working as an instructor. They may participate in Daily Open time as set forth in Section 8.L. This subsection only applies to a Flight Attendant who becomes a training instructor.

input: What is the vacation policy for Flight Attendants?
output: Flight Attendants will accrue vacation on a monthly basis, and they are eligible to take it the following year. Vacation accrual rates shall be no less favorable than those of Pilots. In the first year of employment, vacation accrual is prorated.

input: How is vacation accrued for Flight Attendants in their first year?
output: In the first year, vacation accrual is prorated based on the month of hire. For example, a Flight Attendant hired on January 1st will receive 28 hours of vacation credited, while one hired on December 31st will receive only 2.34 hours.

input: What is the vacation accrual rate for Flight Attendants after their first year?
output: After the first year, the vacation accrual rate increases based on years of service. For example, a Flight Attendant in their 5th year will have a monthly accrual rate of 7.0 hours and an annual total of 84 hours.

input: What happens to vacation accrual for Flight Attendants who go on inactive status?
output: Flight Attendants on inactive status are entitled to a prorated vacation based on their period of active service during the accrual year. The monthly accrual will be 1/12th of the annual accrual.

input: How is vacation balance shown to Flight Attendants?
output: Each Flight Attendant will receive a statement showing their vacation accrual balance on each paycheck.

input: What is the vacation accrual rate for Flight Attendants after their first year of employment?
output: The vacation accrual rate increases based on years of service. For example, a Flight Attendant in their 5th year will have a monthly accrual rate of 7.0 hours and an annual total of 84 hours.

input: What is the vacation accrual rate for Flight Attendants after their 10th year of employment?
output: A Flight Attendant in their 10th year will have a monthly accrual rate of 8.17 hours and an annual total of 98 hours.

input: What is the vacation accrual rate for Flight Attendants after their 15th year of employment?
output: A Flight Attendant in their 15th year will have a monthly accrual rate of 9.33 hours and an annual total of 112 hours.

input: What is the vacation accrual rate for Flight Attendants after their 20th year of employment?
output: A Flight Attendant in their 20th year will have a monthly accrual rate of 10.5 hours and an annual total of 126 hours.

input: What is the vacation accrual rate for Flight Attendants after their 25th year of employment?
output: A Flight Attendant in their 25th year will have a monthly accrual rate of 11.67 hours and an annual total of 140 hours.

input: What are the vacation periods like at my airline?
output: Vacation periods are established every week of the year, starting on Monday at 0001 and ending on Sunday at 2400. Each period is equivalent to twenty-eight (28) credit hours.

input: How many vacation slots can I bid for?
output: There are a minimum of two (2) vacation slots available for bid for each one hundred (100) flight hours.

input: Can I take a vacation during the weekend?
output: Vacation periods begin on Monday at 0001 and end on Sunday at 2400, so you can plan your vacation around these times.

input: What is the process for annual vacation bidding and awarding?
output: Annual Vacation Bidding and Awarding Vacation shall be granted in order of seniority at each base in accordance with the following procedures: 1. A Flight Attendant shall bid vacation based upon their base assignment effective January 1st of the vacation year. 2. By October 1st of each year, the Company shall publish a list in seniority order showing the projected accrued vacation as of the end of that calendar year. 3. Annual vacation bids shall be published by 1200 ET October 16th of each year and posted electronically. Bids shall close by 1200 ET on November 16th. Awards will be posted electronically by November 30th.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 11C Annual Vacation Bidding and Awarding

input: When is the deadline for publishing annual vacation bids?
output: Annual vacation bids shall be published by 1200 ET October 16th of each year and posted electronically. Bids shall close by 1200 ET on November 16th.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 11C Annual Vacation Bidding and Awarding

input: How should a Flight Attendant bid for their earned vacation?
output: A Flight Attendant shall bid for all earned vacation in increments of twenty-eight (28) hours per vacation period. Earned vacation of an amount less than twenty-eight (28) hours shall be designated as Float Vacation in accordance with paragraph E. below. Example: An 11th year Flight Attendant has accrued 98 hours to be used in the following year. The Flight Attendant may bid for three (3) vacation periods (3 x 28 = 84 hours) and use their remaining vacation (14 hours) as Float Vacation.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 11C Annual Vacation Bidding and Awarding

input: How is float vacation designated during the initial vacation bidding process?
output: Designation of Float Vacation hours during the initial vacation bidding process shall be as follows: a. A Flight Attendant may designate up to one (1) vacation period (28 hours) per calendar year as Float Vacation on a day at a time basis. b. Any remaining increment of earned vacation less than twenty-eight (28) hours shall be used as Float Vacation on a day at a time basis. c. A Flight Attendant must notify the Company of their intent to use a portion of their vacation as Float Vacation at the time of the initial vacation bids or within ninety (90) days after the final vacation awards.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 11C Annual Vacation Bidding and Awarding

input: How are vacation periods awarded?
output: Vacation periods shall be awarded in seniority order. The most senior Flight Attendant shall be granted their choices of all earned vacation time before the next most senior Flight Attendant’s choices are considered.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 11C Annual Vacation Bidding and Awarding

input: Can I trade my earned vacation period with an open vacation period?
output: Yes, you can request to trade your earned vacation period(s) with open vacation period(s). The request must be submitted electronically on the appropriate form not later than the fifth (5th) of the month preceding the month containing the earlier vacation period.

input: What happens if I voluntarily trade a vacation period with open vacation?
output: If you voluntarily trade a vacation period(s) with open vacation, you must concurrently pick up another available period(s) within the same calendar year.

input: How are trades with open vacation awarded?
output: Trades with open vacation shall be awarded in seniority order and published in the monthly bid package and on the web site.

input: Can I trade my vacation period(s) with another Flight Attendant at the same base within the same calendar year?
output: Yes, you can trade your vacation period(s) with another Flight Attendant at the same base within the same calendar year. The request must be submitted electronically on the appropriate form not later than the fifth (5th) of the month preceding the month containing the earlier vacation.

input: How do I pick up open vacation slots?
output: A Flight Attendant who previously designated a vacation period (28 hours) as Float Vacation, or who has sufficient hours to equal a full vacation period, may elect to pick up a vacation slot from monthly open vacation. The request must be submitted electronically on the appropriate form not later than the fifth (5th) of the month preceding the month containing the open vacation slot.

input: What happens if I lose my vacation period because of a voluntary transfer?
output: If you lose your vacation period because of a voluntary transfer, you may select a vacation from open vacation slots in your new base or convert the vacation period as Float Vacation in accordance with paragraph C.5., above and paragraph I., below.

input: Can my training be scheduled during my vacation without my consent?
output: The Company shall not schedule a Flight Attendant’s training during the Flight Attendant’s vacation without the Flight Attendant’s consent. If you consent, you may select a vacation slot from available open vacation slots during the current calendar year, use the vacation as Float Vacation, or carry it over to the following year.

input: What happens if I assume a full-time management or a full time training position?
output: If you assume a full-time management or a full-time training position, you must drop your assigned vacation slot into open vacation.

input: Can I request float vacation (VFL) days at any time during the year?
output: Yes, you can request float vacation (VFL) days at any time during the year, except on critical days when they are not allowed.

input: How will I be paid if I use my float vacation (VFL) to cover a pairing?
output: If you use your float vacation (VFL) to cover a pairing, you will be paid for the credited hours of the trip based on how much float vacation (VFL) you have available. Your vacation bank will also be reduced by the same amount of hours paid.

input: How will I be paid if I am a reserve flight attendant and use my float vacation (VFL) to cover reserve day(s)?
output: If you are a reserve flight attendant and use your float vacation (VFL) to cover reserve days, you will be paid four hours of vacation pay for each reserve day off. Your vacation bank will also be reduced by the same amount of hours paid.

input: How can I designate a guaranteed floating day (GFD)?
output: You may notify crew scheduling twice per calendar month of your intent to designate a GFD on a scheduled day off. The GFD will be paid at a straight hourly rate of four hours per day, and a maximum of eight hours per month will be deducted from your vacation bank.

input: What happens to any unused time remaining in my float vacation (VFL) bank at the end of the year?
output: At your option, any unused time remaining in your float vacation (VFL) bank at the end of the year will be paid out in your final paycheck of the year.

input: How many hours will be deducted from my Vacation Bank for seven (7) days of vacation?
output: Twenty-eight (28) hours will be deducted from your Vacation Bank for seven (7) days of vacation.

input: As a language qualified Flight Attendant, how am I credit protected during my scheduled annual vacation period?
output: You will be credit protected for all designated language position hours that were originally scheduled during the vacation period.

input: How is a Float Vacation Day charged and credited to me?
output: A Float Vacation Day will be charged and credited on an hour-for-hour basis to the extent that you have adequate Float Vacation hours available.

input: What happens to my Reserve Days when I go on vacation?
output: Reserve Days will be charged and credited at the rate of four (4) hours for each Reserve Day converted to Float Vacation.

input: Can I postpone my vacation?
output: The Company may not cancel a Flight Attendant’s scheduled vacation. If Company operations necessitate the postponement of vacations, the Company shall first solicit volunteers for such postponement. If there are insufficient volunteers, the Company will offer vacation buy back. If the Company offers vacation buy back and there are insufficient volunteers, the Company may make involuntary postponements in inverse seniority order.

input: How are voluntary postponements awarded?
output: Voluntary postponements shall be awarded in seniority order.

input: How are involuntary postponements awarded?
output: Involuntary postponements shall be awarded in inverse order of seniority.

input: What options do I have if my vacation is postponed?
output: A Flight Attendant whose vacation is postponed may either select a vacation from open vacation periods available during the current year or carry it over to the following year. Vacation time carried over to the next year as a result of a Company postponement shall not be subject to a carry-over cap. A Flight Attendant’s vacation shall not be involuntarily postponed two (2) years in a row.

input: What compensation do I receive if my vacation is postponed?
output: A Flight Attendant whose vacation is postponed either voluntarily or involuntarily shall receive as much notice as possible of such postponement and shall be compensated for any payments or deposits which are unrecoverable due to the postponement within thirty (30) days after submission of claim. The Flight Attendant may be required to provide documentation of such loss.

input: What happens if I become ill or injured while on vacation?
output: If a Flight Attendant becomes ill or injured while on vacation and such illness or injury requires hospitalization or surgery, the Flight Attendant may postpone any remaining days in the Flight Attendant’s vacation and elect to receive sick leave and/or disability for the remainder of the vacation period instead. The Flight Attendant shall notify the Company of the illness or injury as soon as possible. Such Flight Attendant may select from the remaining open vacation periods or carry over the postponed vacation.

input: What happens if I accept a TDY or special assignment while on vacation?
output: If a Flight Attendant accepts a TDY or any special assignment including Union leave, the Flight Attendant may postpone a scheduled vacation. Such Flight Attendant may select from the remaining open vacation periods or carry over the postponed vacation.

input: What is vacation buy back?
output: Vacation Buy Back is an option for Flight Attendants to sell back their unused vacation time to the Company. The Company shall offer vacation buy back prior to postponing vacations in a domicile. The Company may also offer vacation buy back at any other time.

input: When will I be notified of a vacation buyback offer?
output: Flight Attendants will be notified of a vacation buyback offer no later than the fifth (5th) day of the bid month prior to the month in which the buyback will occur.

input: How is vacation buy back awarded?
output: Vacation buy back will be bid for and awarded in domicile seniority order. The bid will be awarded prior to the opening of the next month’s bid. A Flight Attendant awarded vacation buy back will fly their original schedule for the month and will be paid twenty-eight (28) hours at their current pay rate in addition to all other pay and credit for the month.

input: Can I drop a trip that touches my vacation period during the transition period?
output: Yes, all trips which touch a Flight Attendant’s vacation period shall be dropped during the Transition Period.

input: How will my projected bid period credit be affected if I drop a trip outside of my vacation period?
output: Your projected bid period credit will be reduced by the value of the trip hours dropped outside of your vacation period.

input: Can I restore my credit during the Credit Restoration period?
output: Yes, you can elect to pick up flying during Credit Restoration to restore your credit.

input: How can a Reserve Flight Attendant request to attach their immoveable days to their vacation period?
output: A Reserve Flight Attendant may request to attach all or a portion of their immoveable days to their vacation period by notifying Crew Resources within twenty-four (24) hours after the Initial Bid is awarded.

input: What limitations will I need to waive if I want to facilitate being projected for at least the minimum monthly guarantee?
output: You may need to waive contractual limitations concerning minimum days off, maximum block hours in seven (7) days and consecutive days on duty to facilitate being projected for at least the minimum monthly guarantee.

input: Can I bid for a Relief line during my scheduled vacation?
output: Yes, you can bid for a Relief line during your month of scheduled vacation.

input: Will the Company schedule trips within my vacation period if I bid for a Relief line?
output: No, the Company shall not schedule trips within your vacation period if you bid for a Relief line.

input: How many hours of vacation will I be credited with if I bid for a Relief line during my scheduled vacation?
output: You will be charged and credited with twenty-eight (28) hours of vacation if you bid for a Relief line during your scheduled vacation.

input: How many hours of vacation can I carry over to the following year?
output: You can carry over up to twenty-eight (28) hours of vacation credit to the following year.

input: Can I choose to receive a payout for my unused vacation credit instead of carrying it over?
output: Yes, you have the option to receive a payout for your unused vacation credit remaining in your vacation bank in your final paycheck of the year.

input: Can I carry over more than twenty-eight (28) hours of vacation credit to the next year?
output: No, you can only carry over up to twenty-eight (28) hours of vacation credit to the next year. Any unused vacation credit beyond that limit will be paid out in your final paycheck of the year.

input: Are there any exceptions to the rule of carrying over vacation credit?
output: Yes, there are certain exceptions where vacation credit may be carried over in accordance with paragraphs D.5., G.3., G.5., G.6., and J.5. These provisions may allow for additional carryover of vacation credit beyond the standard limit of twenty-eight (28) hours.

input: What happens to my unused vacation credit if I don’t use it within a year?
output: If you do not use all of your vacation credit within a year, any remaining balance will be paid out in your final paycheck of the year. You cannot carry over more than twenty-eight (28) hours of unused vacation credit to the next year.

input: Can I choose to receive a payout for my unused vacation credit instead of carrying it over?
output: Yes, you have the option to receive a payout for your unused vacation credit instead of carrying it over to the next year. This payout will be included in your final paycheck of the year.

input: Can I take my vacation while on leave?
output: No, a Flight Attendant is not required to be available for contact while on their vacation nor shall the Flight Attendant be required to keep the Company informed of their whereabouts. However, if you are on leave during your scheduled vacation period, you may choose to accept a payout of the vacation, bid for an open week in the same calendar year, or carry over up to twenty-eight (28) hours to the next year or any combination of the above.

input: How can I access my vacation transactions?
output: A copy of all vacation transactions will be published electronically for your reference.

input: Is there a deadline for using my awarded vacation hours?
output: No Flight Attendant shall be required to take a vacation other than that awarded or assigned to the Flight Attendant in accordance with this Section. You can use your vacation hours at any time during the year, as long as it does not interfere with your work schedule and responsibilities.

input: How do I check my available vacation hours?
output: The Company shall maintain accurate vacation records. Each Flight Attendant shall be provided a statement of their available vacation hours with each paycheck. You can also check your vacation balance through the company’s online portal or by contacting the crew scheduler.

input: Can I carry over my unused vacation hours to the next year?
output: Yes, you can carry over up to twenty-eight (28) hours to the next year or any combination of the above. If you are unable to use your vacation because you are on leave, you have the option to accept a payout of the vacation, bid for an open week in the same calendar year, or carry over up to twenty-eight (28) hours to the next year or any combination of the above.

input: How many sick leave hours can I accrue each month?
output: You can accrue up to four (4.0) hours of sick leave credit per full calendar month of active service with the company, with a maximum overall limit of five hundred (500) hours in both the primary and secondary sick leave banks.

input: Who is responsible for keeping track of my sick leave accrual?
output: The company is responsible for maintaining accurate sick bank accrual records and will provide you with that information on a monthly basis.

input: How many hours are deposited into my primary sick leave bank each month?
output: Three (3) hours of your total sick leave accrual in paragraph A will be deposited into your primary sick leave bank for each full calendar month of active service, with a maximum limit of two hundred twenty (220) hours. If your primary bank has reached the maximum accrual, the three (3) hours of monthly accrual will be credited to your secondary bank.

input: What is the purpose of my secondary sick leave bank?
output: The secondary sick leave bank is intended for use in cases of long-term illness, which is defined as having a medically documented illness for a duration of longer than two (2) weeks. One (1) hour of sick leave will be deposited into your secondary bank each full calendar month of active service, with a maximum limit of five hundred (500) hours. You can start using your secondary bank’s sick leave from the first day of an illness if you submit medical documentation showing that the illness is expected to last longer than two (2) weeks.

input: How many hours of sick leave can I accrue in my primary bank each month?
output: You can accrue up to three (3) hours of sick leave in your primary bank each month, in addition to the total accrual in Paragraph A. Sick Leave Accrual.

input: What happens if I reach the maximum accrual in my primary bank?
output: If you reach the maximum accrual of two hundred twenty (220) hours in your primary bank, any additional sick leave accrued will be credited to your secondary bank.

input: How long do I need to be ill to use my secondary bank for sick leave?
output: You can use your secondary bank for sick leave if you have a medically documented illness that is expected to last longer than two (2) weeks.

input: When can I start using my secondary bank for sick leave?
output: You can start using your secondary bank for sick leave from the first day of your illness, provided you submit medical documentation showing that your illness is expected to last longer than two (2) weeks.

input: Am I eligible for the Perfect Attendance Incentive Program?
output: Yes, as a Flight Attendant, you are eligible to participate in any Perfect Attendance Incentive Program that the Company institutes for the general population.

input: How can I earn additional sick leave through perfect attendance?
output: You can accrue one (1) additional hour of sick leave in your primary bank for every three (3) months with perfect attendance and an average of ninety-five (95) credited hours during that time.

input: Can I still accrue sick leave if I’m on an unpaid personal leave for 30 days?
output: Yes, you will continue to accrue Sick Leave as if you remained in active service during that time.

input: Will I lose my accumulated sick leave if I take a furlough or leave of absence?
output: No, you will retain but not accrue Sick Leave while on furlough or leave of absence except as otherwise provided in the Collective Barganing Agreement.

input: How does jury duty affect my sick leave accumulation?
output: Jury duty is considered active service, so you will continue to accrue Sick Leave during that time.

input: Can I use my sick leave for bereavement purposes?
output: No, Sick Leave is intended for your own illness or injury and cannot be used for bereavement purposes.

input: What happens to my sick leave if I’m on military leave?
output: While on military leave, you will retain but not accrue Sick Leave unless otherwise provided in this Agreement.

input: Can I use my sick leave for Union leave?
output: No, Sick Leave is not intended for Union-related purposes and cannot be used for Union leave.

input: How does vacation affect my sick leave accumulation?
output: Vacation is considered active service, so you will continue to accrue Sick Leave during that time.

input: Can I use my sick leave for Worker’s Compensation Leave?
output: No, Sick Leave is not intended for Worker’s Compensation purposes and cannot be used for Worker’s Compensation Leave.

input: What happens when a flight attendant loses hours due to their own personal illness or injury?
output: The flight attendant will be credited with the scheduled time of the trip(s) lost and the equivalent amount will be deducted from their Sick Bank, as long as they have accrued Sick Leave. If they don’t have enough hours in their Sick Bank, they will only be paid to the extent of available hours and their bid line guarantee will be adjusted accordingly.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 12E Use of Accrued Sick Leave

input: How is a reserve flight attendant credited when they miss scheduled reserve duty?
output: A reserve flight attendant will be credited with four (4) hours for each day of scheduled reserve duty missed, to the extent that they have accrued Sick Leave. An amount equivalent to the credited hours will be deducted from their Sick Bank. If they don’t have enough hours in their Sick Bank, they won’t receive any additional payment.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 12E Use of Accrued Sick Leave

input: What happens when a flight attendant is on family medical leave?
output: The flight attendant can use their accrued Sick Leave to cover the time off, and will be credited and deducted from their Sick Bank as described in paragraph E.1. If they don’t have enough hours in their Sick Bank, they won’t receive any additional payment.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 12E Use of Accrued Sick Leave

input: Can a flight attendant borrow sick leave hours?
output: Yes, a flight attendant can borrow up to 24 hours of Sick Leave if they haven’t accrued enough hours to cover their own personal illness or injury, or to care for an ill or injured dependent minor child. The borrowed hours must be repaid each month by the amount of Sick Leave hours accrued during subsequent months of active service and reconciled within six (6) months of the flight attendant’s return from absence. If the flight attendant leaves employment with the company before repaying the borrowed hours, the amount due will be deducted from their final paycheck.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 12E Use of Accrued Sick Leave

input: Who is eligible to borrow Sick Leave hours?
output: Flight attendants who are in their first year of employment with the company, flight attendants in the first year following an FMLA leave during which they exhausted all accrued Sick Leave hours, and flight attendants who have one continuous illness or injury anticipated to last two (2) or more weeks and who have no available Secondary Sick Bank hours are eligible to borrow Sick Leave hours.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 12E Use of Accrued Sick Leave

input: What are the terms for repaying borrowed Sick Leave hours?
output: The borrowed hours must be repaid each month by the amount of Sick Leave hours accrued during subsequent months of active service and reconciled within six (6) months of the flight attendant’s return from absence. They may also be repaid in accordance with the provisions of paragraphs G.1. and G.2. below, and if not repaid before leaving employment with the company, the amount due will be deducted from their final paycheck.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 12E Use of Accrued Sick Leave

input: How many hours’ notice must a flight attendant provide when they are unable to fly a scheduled trip due to illness?
output: A Flight Attendant who is unable to fly a scheduled trip due to circumstances described in this Section shall notify Crew Scheduling as far in advance as possible, generally with at least two (2) hours’ notice unless there are extenuating circumstances.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 12F Crew Scheduling Notification Sick

input: What should a flight attendant do if they become sick during their pairing?
output: A Flight Attendant assigned a pairing(s) must notify Crew Scheduling prior to the start of each pairing for which the Flight Attendant is sick.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 12F Crew Scheduling Notification Sick

input: How should a reserve flight attendant handle sick days when scheduled for a reserve shift?
output: A Reserve Flight Attendant must notify Crew Scheduling every day the Flight Attendant is sick and scheduled for a Reserve Shift. If a Reserve Flight Attendant knows they will be out sick for more than one (1) Reserve Day, the Reserve Flight Attendant may notify Crew Scheduling to be placed on Sick Leave for multiple days provided that the Reserve Flight Attendant submits medical documentation stating an anticipated date of return to duty.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 12F Crew Scheduling Notification Sick

input: Is a flight attendant required to disclose the reason for their illness when notifying crew scheduling?
output: A Flight Attendant is not obligated under any circumstances to discuss or inform Crew Scheduling of the reason for the illness.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 12F Crew Scheduling Notification Sick

input: What should a flight attendant do when they are cleared from sick status?
output: When clearing from sick, a Flight Attendant shall notify Crew Scheduling with as much advance notice as possible.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 12F Crew Scheduling Notification Sick

input: How is a flight attendant’s status determined if they return to duty before the completion of their missed trip while on sick leave?
output: A Flight Attendant who clears from sick prior to the completion of their missed trip will be considered on Time Recoverable Status in accordance with Section 8.N.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 12F Crew Scheduling Notification Sick

input: Can I designate credit hours above the minimum monthly guarantee as Sick Leave Make-up instead of compensation?
output: Yes, you can choose to designate your excess credit hours above the minimum monthly guarantee as Sick Leave Make-up in lieu of compensation.

input: What happens to the excess hours if I have more sick leave make-up hours than the sick leave used?
output: Any excess hours will be paid and credited in that bid period.

input: Can I pick up Open Time or Reserve days in addition to my scheduled trips for sick leave make-up?
output: Yes, you can request to pick up additional Open Time or Reserve days as Sick Leave Make-up. Just make sure to designate it in writing and credit the hours back to the Sick Bank.

input: I’d like to request sick leave make-up for the days I was on sick leave.
output: Sure, you can designate your Open Time or Reserve days as Sick Leave Make-up in writing and credit the hours back to the Sick Bank. Any excess hours will be paid and credited in that bid period.

input: What is the sick bank payout policy for flight attendants who retire from active status?
output: The Company shall provide a lump sum Sick Bank Pay-out to those Flight Attendants who retire from active status and meet the following criteria: 1. A Flight Attendant who retires from active service at age fifty-five (55) or higher after ten (10) years of service shall be paid for the Flight Attendant’s accumulated Sick Leave at seventy percent (70%) of the Flight Attendant’s hourly rate of pay. 2. A Flight Attendant who resigns from active service after fifteen (15) years of service shall be paid for the Flight Attendant’s accumulated Sick Leave at fifty percent (50%) of the Flight Attendant’s hourly rate of pay.

input: How is the sick bank payout calculated for a flight attendant who retires from active service after ten years and before age 55?
output: The Flight Attendant who retires from active service at age fifty-five (55) or higher after ten (10) years of service shall be paid for the Flight Attendant’s accumulated Sick Leave at seventy percent (70%) of the Flight Attendant’s hourly rate of pay.

input: How is the sick bank payout calculated for a flight attendant who resigns from active service after fifteen years and meets the eligibility criteria?
output: A Flight Attendant who resigns from active service after fifteen (15) years of service shall be paid for the Flight Attendant’s accumulated Sick Leave at fifty percent (50%) of the Flight Attendant’s hourly rate of pay.

input: Can a flight attendant who retires early and has less than ten years of service receive a sick bank payout?
output: No, a Flight Attendant who retires from active service at age fifty-five (55) or higher after ten (10) years of service shall be paid for the Flight Attendant’s accumulated Sick Leave at seventy percent (70%) of the Flight Attendant’s hourly rate of pay. A Flight Attendant who resigns from active service after fifteen (15) years of service shall be paid for the Flight Attendant’s accumulated Sick Leave at fifty percent (50%) of the Flight Attendant’s hourly rate of pay.

input: Is there a minimum number of years of service required to receive a sick bank payout upon retirement?
output: Yes, a Flight Attendant who retires from active service at age fifty-five (55) or higher after ten (10) years of service shall be paid for the Flight Attendant’s accumulated Sick Leave at seventy percent (70%) of the Flight Attendant’s hourly rate of pay. A Flight Attendant who resigns from active service after fifteen (15) years of service shall be paid for the Flight Attendant’s accumulated Sick Leave at fifty percent (50%) of the Flight Attendant’s hourly rate of pay.

input: Can a flight attendant choose to receive their sick bank payout as a lump sum or in installments?
output: The Company shall provide a lump sum Sick Bank Pay-out to those Flight Attendants who retire from active status and meet the following criteria: 1. A Flight Attendant who retires from active service at age fifty-five (55) or higher after ten (10) years of service shall be paid for the Flight Attendant’s accumulated Sick Leave at seventy percent (70%) of the Flight Attendant’s hourly rate of pay. 2. A Flight Attendant who resigns from active service after fifteen (15) years of service shall be paid for the Flight Attendant’s accumulated Sick Leave at fifty percent (50%) of the Flight Attendant’s hourly rate of pay. The payout is provided as a lump sum payment, not in installments.

input: What should I do if I become ill or injured away from base?
output: You should be returned positive space to your base or home within twenty-four (24) hours on the earliest available open flight. If you are too ill to return home, the Company will continue to provide per diem and a hotel room until the end of your originally assigned trip or until you return to base or home if you provide medical documentation prior to the end of the originally assigned trip that you are unable to travel.

input: Can I accept transitional duty employment if offered by the Company?
output: Yes, you may voluntarily accept transitional duty employment if offered by the Company.

input: What happens if there is a reasonable basis to suspect abuse of Sick Leave?
output: If there is a reasonable basis to suspect abuse of Sick Leave, on an individual basis, the Company may request a physician’s certificate for the absence. At your request, the Company will reimburse your copay for the Company-required physician statement and select the physician. If you choose to select your own physician, you will be responsible for the co-pay for the visit. The Company will notify the LEC President when sick leave abuse is suspected of a Flight Attendant.

input: Where can I find information about my sick leave accrual and sick leave bank?
output: Sick leave accrual and sick leave bank information will appear on your pay statement.

input: Can I request a personal leave of absence?
output: Yes, you can request a personal leave of absence if you are not on probation. The duration of the leave cannot exceed six months, but it may be extended beyond that period. You will retain your bid seniority and continue to accrue longevity for pay purposes during the entire leave period. If your leave exceeds 60 days, you will be entitled to health benefits for the duration of the leave upon reimbursement to the Company on a monthly basis at the applicable COBRA rate.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13A Personal Leave of Absence

input: What happens to my seniority and longevity while I’m on personal leave?
output: While on personal leave, you will retain and continue to accrue bid seniority. You will also retain and continue to accrue longevity for pay purposes for the first thirty days of your leave.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13A Personal Leave of Absence

input: What if I want to return from my personal leave before the expiration date?
output: If operational needs permit, you may be allowed to return from your personal leave before the expiration date.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13A Personal Leave of Absence

input: How are leaves of absence granted when there are limited leave days available?
output: When a limited number of leave days are available, leaves of absences are granted in seniority order. However, the Company may use its discretion at any time to grant a leave of absence to a Flight Attendant in an emergency situation or in a situation where the Vice President of Inflight or her designee and the Union agree that granting such a leave is appropriate.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13A Personal Leave of Absence

input: Are there any conditions for reimbursement of health benefits during my personal leave?
output: Yes, if your personal leave exceeds 60 days, you will be entitled to health benefits for the duration of the leave upon reimbursement to the Company on a monthly basis at the applicable COBRA rate.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13A Personal Leave of Absence

input: Can I take a year of unpaid leave for the birth or adoption of a child?
output: Yes, as per our policy, you are eligible for one year of continuous unpaid leave for the birth or adoption of a child.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13B Family Medical Leave of Absence

input: How long can I take off for care of a spouse, child, or parent with a serious health condition?
output: You are entitled to take up to one year of unpaid leave for the care of a spouse, child, or parent with a serious health condition.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13B Family Medical Leave of Absence

input: Can I take a year of continuous unpaid leave for my own serious medical condition?
output: Yes, you are eligible for one year of continuous unpaid leave for the care of your own serious medical condition.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13B Family Medical Leave of Absence

input: Do I need to provide advance notice before taking FMLA leave?
output: The Company may require reasonable advance notice of intent to take FMLA leave, if practicable.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13B Family Medical Leave of Absence

input: Will my health benefits continue during my leave?
output: Your health benefits shall continue for the first ninety days of your leave at the same benefit level and cost as if you were not on leave. For leaves exceeding ninety days, you will be entitled to health benefits for the duration of the leave upon reimbursement to the Company on a monthly basis of the full cost of such benefits at the applicable COBRA rate.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13B Family Medical Leave of Absence

input: Can I use my accumulated sick leave and vacation before starting unpaid leave?
output: Yes, you may choose to take any accumulated sick leave and accrued vacation prior to beginning unpaid leave.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13B Family Medical Leave of Absence

input: Will my seniority and longevity be affected during my FMLA leave?
output: You will retain and continue to accrue bid seniority for the entire leave period, and you will retain and continue to accrue longevity for pay purposes for up to ninety days.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13B Family Medical Leave of Absence

input: How many months of continuous unpaid leave can a Flight Attendant take for the birth or adoption of a child?
output: A Flight Attendant who has completed twelve (12) months of service with the Company, and who has maintained a minimum of 504 credit hours during the previous twelve (12) months, may take up to one (1) year of continuous unpaid leave for the birth or adoption of a child.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13B Family Medical Leave of Absence

input: Can a Flight Attendant take unpaid leave for care of a spouse, child, or parent with a serious health condition?
output: Yes, a Flight Attendant may take up to one (1) year of unpaid leave for care of a spouse, child, or parent with a serious health condition.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13B Family Medical Leave of Absence

input: How long can a Flight Attendant take continuous unpaid leave for care of their own serious medical condition?
output: A Flight Attendant may take up to one (1) year of continuous unpaid leave for care of their own serious medical condition.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13B Family Medical Leave of Absence

input: Will the Company continue providing health benefits during FMLA leave?
output: The Company shall at all times remain in compliance with the requirements of the Family Medical Leave Act of 1993, as amended, including intermittent FMLA, as those provisions apply to the Company. A Flight Attendant’s health benefits shall continue for the first ninety (90) days of the leave set forth above at the same benefit level and cost as if the Flight Attendant were not on leave.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13B Family Medical Leave of Absence

input: Can a Flight Attendant take accumulated sick leave and accrued vacation before beginning unpaid leave?
output: A Flight Attendant who ceases to perform flight duties pursuant to paragraph B.1. above may, at the Flight Attendant’s option, take any accumulated sick leave and accrued vacation prior to beginning unpaid leave.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13B Family Medical Leave of Absence

input: Will a Flight Attendant retain bid seniority and continue to accrue longevity for pay purposes during FMLA leave?
output: Yes, a Flight Attendant on FMLA leave shall retain and continue to accrue bid seniority for the entire leave period. The Flight Attendant shall retain and continue to accrue longevity for pay purposes for up to ninety (90) days.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13B Family Medical Leave of Absence

input: I have a serious medical condition that requires me to take an extended leave of absence. Can I be granted an unpaid medical leave of up to 42 months?
output: Yes, if you provide satisfactory medical evidence and meet the criteria outlined in our company policy, you may be eligible for an unpaid medical leave of up to 42 months. This leave will run concurrently with FMLA.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13C Medical Leave of Absence

input: What happens to my seniority while I’m on this extended medical leave?
output: While on an unpaid medical leave, you will continue to accrue seniority as if you were on FMLA. This ensures that your seniority remains intact upon your return to work.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13C Medical Leave of Absence

input: I’ve exhausted my sick leave bank and FMLA eligibility. Can I still be granted an unpaid medical leave?
output: Yes, if you meet the criteria outlined in our company policy and provide satisfactory medical evidence, you may be eligible for an unpaid medical leave of up to 42 months.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13C Medical Leave of Absence

input: Is there a limit on how long I can take this unpaid medical leave?
output: The maximum duration for an unpaid medical leave is 42 months, as outlined in our company policy.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13C Medical Leave of Absence

input: Can I request a shorter leave of absence if my medical condition improves before the 42-month period ends?
output: Yes, you can request a shorter leave of absence if your medical condition improves before the 42-month period ends. We will work with you and your doctor to determine the appropriate duration for your leave.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13C Medical Leave of Absence

input: How much unpaid leave can I take after the birth or adoption of my child?
output: You may take up to one (1) year of unpaid leave upon birth or adoption of a child.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13D Maternity Paternity Leave of Absence

input: Will my health benefits continue during my maternity/paternity/adoption/newborn leave?
output: Yes, your health benefits will continue for the first ninety (90) days at the same benefit level and cost as if you were not on leave. For leaves in excess of ninety (90) days, you can continue to receive health benefits for the duration of the leave upon reimbursement to the Company on a monthly basis of the full cost of such benefits at the applicable COBRA rate.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13D Maternity Paternity Leave of Absence

input: Can I work while on maternity/paternity/adoption/newborn leave?
output: No, if you are certified as unable to fulfill your duties due to pregnancy or childbirth, you will be granted a Maternity Leave of Absence and will not be able to work until cleared by a physician. If you take the Newborn Leave of Absence, you may return to work earlier if desired but are not required to do so.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13D Maternity Paternity Leave of Absence

input: What happens to my seniority while on maternity/paternity/adoption/newborn leave?
output: Your seniority will be maintained during your leave of absence. Upon your return to work, you will resume your previous position and seniority, subject to any changes that may have occurred during your absence.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13D Maternity Paternity Leave of Absence

input: Can I take a leave of absence for other medical reasons?
output: The Company may grant a leave of absence for other medical reasons in its sole discretion, subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement. However, the provisions related to Maternity/Paternity/Adoption/Newborn Leave of Absence will apply if you meet the eligibility criteria specified in Section D.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13D Maternity Paternity Leave of Absence

input: How long is Workers’ Compensation Leave approved for?
output: A Workers’ Compensation Leave shall be approved based upon proper medical certification and timely completion of required documentation up to a maximum of forty two (42) months.

input: Can Workers’ Compensation Leave run concurrently with an FMLA leave of absence?
output: No, Workers’ Compensation Leave shall not run concurrently with an FMLA leave of absence.

input: What happens to a Flight Attendant’s bid period guarantees when they go on Workers’ Compensation leave due to an aircraft accident?
output: Following a Workers’ Compensation illness or injury, verified with proper medical documentation, which is caused by an aircraft accident as defined as an occurrence associated with the operation of an aircraft which takes place between the time any person boards the aircraft with the intention of flight and all such persons have disembarked, and in which any person suffers death or serious injury, or in which the aircraft receives substantial damage, the Company shall provide: a) Bid period guarantees protection for the remainder of the bid period in which the illness or injury occurs; b) Bid period guarantee protection for the following next bid period.

input: How long will a Flight Attendant continue to receive health benefits after going on Workers’ Compensation leave?
output: A Flight Attendant on Workers’ Compensation leave shall continue to receive health benefits for one (1) year at the same benefit level and cost as if the Flight Attendant were not on leave. A Flight Attendant on Workers’ Compensation leave in excess of one (1) year shall be entitled to health benefits for the duration of the leave only upon reimbursement to the Company on a monthly basis of the full cost of such benefits at the applicable COBRA rate.

input: Will a Flight Attendant’s longevity for pay and benefit purposes and bid seniority be retained and accrued while on Workers’ Compensation leave?
output: Yes, Longevity for pay and benefit purposes and bid seniority shall be retained and accrued.

input: Can a Flight Attendant use their accrued vacation and/or accrued sick leave credit to supplement the Workers’ Compensation benefit during an occupational injury or illness?
output: Yes, when a Flight Attendant is absent from work because of an occupational injury or illness for which the Flight Attendant received Workers’ Compensation payments from the applicable state or payments as provided in the Federal Longshoremen’s and Harbor Workers’ Act, the Flight Attendant may use their accrued vacation and/or accrued sick leave credit to supplement the benefit not to exceed the applicable minimum bid period guarantee beginning with the date of illness or injury.

input: What benefits will Flight Attendants engaged in international flying receive for Workers’ Compensation purposes?
output: For Workers’ Compensation purposes, Flight Attendants engaged in international flying as defined in this Agreement shall be provided the benefits of all the provisions of the Federal Longshoremen’s and Harbor Workers’ Act in effect at the time of the occurrence which gives rise to the claim for benefits.

input: Are there any restrictions on the amount of Light Duty a Flight Attendant may be required to perform while on Workers’ Compensation Leave?
output: Yes, a Flight Attendant who performs Light Duty will not be required to spend more days in the month performing Light Duty than the Flight Attendant would have flown. The Company will use the Flight Attendant’s bid awards in the last three (3) months of active service to determine the average number of days off. A Flight Attendant will not be required to perform more than eight (8) hours of Light Duty in a day.

input: Will a Flight Attendant be required to travel outside of their metropolitan area to perform Light Duty while on Workers’ Compensation Leave?
output: No, a Flight Attendant will not be required to travel outside of the metropolitan area in which the Flight Attendant resides to perform the Light Duty assignment.

input: I need to request a military leave of absence for two weeks.
output: You will be initially coded as PLI and when HR receives your military orders they will recode it to MIL for military leave.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13F Military Leave of Absence

input: Can I have an idea of what my schedule will look like after returning from military leave?
output: Unfortunately, we cannot predict your schedule upon your return since it depends on various factors such as flight schedules and crew availability. However, we will do our best to accommodate your preferences.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13F Military Leave of Absence

input: What are the reemployment rights and benefits for military leaves?
output: As required by law, you will be granted an unpaid military leave of absence. Your reemployment rights and benefits will be governed by applicable statute.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13F Military Leave of Absence

input: Can I request an extension to my military leave if my duty extends beyond the initial two weeks?
output: Yes, you can request an extension. However, it will depend on the availability of your replacement and other operational factors.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13F Military Leave of Absence

input: Will my seniority and benefits be maintained while I’m on military leave?
output: Yes, your seniority and benefits will be maintained during your military leave of absence as required by law.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13F Military Leave of Absence

input: What is the policy on jury duty leave of absence for flight attendants?
output: When called for jury duty, a Flight Attendant shall be paid and credited for flights missed or reserve days missed at the applicable rate for each calendar day of jury duty served up to twenty (20) days. Jury duty leave pay shall be offset by any amount a Flight Attendant received from the court, excluding mileage and expenses. Claims for jury duty leave shall be made in writing. The Flight Attendant shall notify the Company of release from jury duty so that the Flight Attendant can be placed back on flying status.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13G Jury Duty Leave of Absence

input: How long is a Flight Attendant entitled to jury duty leave?
output: A Flight Attendant is entitled to jury duty leave for up to twenty (20) days.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13G Jury Duty Leave of Absence

input: Is there any way the Company can assist Flight Attendants with jury duty?
output: Upon request, the Company will write a letter to the Court requesting postponement of or excuse from the Flight Attendant’s jury duty.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13G Jury Duty Leave of Absence

input: Can a Flight Attendant receive additional paid time off for serving jury duty beyond twenty (20) days?
output: Nothing herein shall preclude the Union from requesting additional paid time off for a Flight Attendant serving jury duty in excess of twenty (20) days.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13G Jury Duty Leave of Absence

input: I’m sorry to ask, but I need to check our bereavement policy. Can you confirm how many days of unpaid leave can be granted in addition to the five consecutive days?
output: Yes, the Company may grant additional unpaid leave for persons other than the Flight Attendant’s immediate family.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13H Bereavement Leave of Absence

input: I need to take some time off due to a death in my family. Can you please confirm how many days of bereavement leave I am entitled to?
output: Of course, as per our policy, you are entitled to up to five consecutive days of paid bereavement leave. If additional unpaid leave is needed, it may be granted at the company’s discretion.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13H Bereavement Leave of Absence

input: I have a family emergency and need to take some time off. Can I request bereavement leave?
output: Yes, you can certainly request bereavement leave in case of a family emergency. Please provide the necessary documentation and we will process your request accordingly.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13H Bereavement Leave of Absence

input: I’m sorry for the inconvenience, but I need to check on the definition of immediate family for bereavement leave purposes.
output: The immediate family is defined as spouse, domestic partner, children, step-children, parent, stepparent, brother, sister, stepbrother, stepsister, parent-in-law, grandparent, and grandchild. The Company may grant bereavement leave for persons other than the Flight Attendant’s immediate family.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13H Bereavement Leave of Absence

input: I need to take some time off due to a death in my family, but I’m not sure if it falls under our bereavement policy. Can you help me understand the criteria?
output: Yes, as per our policy, bereavement leave is granted for up to five consecutive days for a death in the immediate family. The immediate family includes spouse, domestic partner, children, step-children, parent, stepparent, brother, sister, stepbrother, stepsister, parent-in-law, grandparent, and grandchild. If the person who passed away is not part of your immediate family, the company may still grant bereavement leave at its discretion.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13H Bereavement Leave of Absence

input: I’m sorry to say that my grandfather passed away, can I have bereavement leave?
output: Yes, I’m sorry for your loss. You are entitled to up to five consecutive days of bereavement leave. Let me know if you need additional unpaid leave.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13H Bereavement Leave of Absence

input: I need to take care of some personal matters, can I have a personal leave?
output: Yes, you are allowed to request personal leave. Please provide the necessary documentation and I will do my best to accommodate your request.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13H Bereavement Leave of Absence

input: Can I have bereavement leave for my stepbrother’s death?
output: Yes, you are entitled to up to five consecutive days of bereavement leave for the death of your stepbrother. Let me know if you need additional unpaid leave.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13H Bereavement Leave of Absence

input: I need to take care of my sick child, can I have family and medical leave?
output: Yes, you are entitled to up to twelve weeks of family and medical leave per year. Please provide the necessary documentation and I will do my best to accommodate your request.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13H Bereavement Leave of Absence

input: Can I have bereavement leave for my sister-in-law’s death?
output: Yes, you are entitled to up to five consecutive days of bereavement leave for the death of your sister-in-law. Let me know if you need additional unpaid leave.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13H Bereavement Leave of Absence

input: What is voluntary time off?
output: Voluntary time off (VTO) is a Company-initiated request for Flight Attendants to take time off from work, either with or without pay, based on current business needs.

input: How long can VTO be granted for?
output: VTO may be granted for no more than thirty (30) days.

input: Who has the first right of refusal for VTO?
output: The most senior Flight Attendant has the first right of refusal to any Company-offered voluntary time off with or without pay.

input: Can a Flight Attendant on VTO bid for open trips or other paid assignments?
output: No, while on VTO, a Flight Attendant may not bid for open trips or other paid assignments. The Company will post these offers electronically.

input: Will a Flight Attendant continue to accrue benefits during VTO?
output: Yes, a Flight Attendant shall continue to accrue bid seniority, longevity, and all benefits as if the Flight Attendant were active while on voluntary time off with or without pay.

input: What happens if a Flight Attendant is scheduled for training during VTO?
output: If a Flight Attendant is scheduled for training during the period of VTO and failing to attend the training would cause the Flight Attendant to become de-qualified, they will be required to attend the training.

input: Can a Flight Attendant take the training at an earlier date if available?
output: Yes, a Flight Attendant may take the training at an earlier date if it is available and approved by the Company.

input: What is my job classification and base after returning from an approved leave of absence?
output: Your job classification and base will be reinstated to what they were prior to your leave of absence.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13J General Leave of Absence

input: Do I need to requalify for my job after returning from a leave of absence?
output: Requalification may be required depending on the length of your leave and the specifics of your job. You will need to check with the company for more information.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13J General Leave of Absence

input: What happens if I am on a leave of absence and my seniority would have resulted in furlough?
output: If you are on a leave of absence and your seniority warrants furlough, you will be notified that your rights under the agreement have changed to those of a furloughed Flight Attendant.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13J General Leave of Absence

input: What happens if there is an expansion in service while I am on a leave of absence?
output: If there is an expansion in service and your seniority warrants it, you may be recalled or revert to leave of absence status with the accompanying rights and obligations.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13J General Leave of Absence

input: What happens during Requalification Training or Recurrent Training after a leave of absence?
output: During Requalification or Recurrent Training, you will receive training pay in accordance with Section 3. Active payroll status, including benefits eligibility, shall begin on the first day after the expiration of a leave if you are not required to undergo Requalification or Recurrent Training.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13J General Leave of Absence

input: What happens if I am required to undergo Requalification or Recurrent Training upon returning from a leave of absence?
output: If you are required to undergo Requalification or Recurrent Training, you will be placed on active payroll status upon completion of the training.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13J General Leave of Absence

input: What happens if the company cannot accommodate the 21-day requirement for Requalification or Recurrent Training?
output: If the Company is unable to accommodate the 21-day requirement, you will be placed on active payroll status on the twenty-first (21st) day.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13J General Leave of Absence
