input: What happens if I do not return to work at the expiration of my leave?
output: If you fail to return to work at the expiration of your leave, you will be considered as being on unauthorized leave and may be removed from the seniority list and administratively discharged.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13J General Leave of Absence

input: Can I engage in other outside employment while on a leave of absence?
output: You may engage in other outside employment provided that such employment does not present a conflict of interest as determined by the Vice President of Inflight or her designee.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13J General Leave of Absence

input: What happens to my pass travel privileges while on a leave of absence?
output: The pass travel privileges of a Flight Attendant on a Military Leave, Bereavement Leave, Union Leave or Jury Duty Leave will be the same as if the Flight Attendant were an active Flight Attendant. A Flight Attendant on another type of Leave of Absence who is medically cleared for air travel may request passes, on a case-by-case basis, and will not be unreasonably denied.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13J General Leave of Absence

input: What is the process for reinstatement after an approved leave of absence?
output: The Company shall reinstate the Flight Attendant to the job classification and base held prior to the start of the leave, subject to requalification. If the Flight Attendant’s seniority would have resulted in furlough, they will be notified of their changed rights as a furloughed Flight Attendant. Upon completion of Requalification or Recurrent Training, the Flight Attendant shall receive training pay and active payroll status will begin.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13J General Leave of Absence

input: What happens during Requalification or Recurrent Training after a leave of absence?
output: During Requalification or Recurrent Training (Annual Recertification), a Flight Attendant shall receive training pay in accordance with Section 3.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13J General Leave of Absence

input: How soon can I start training if I require Requalification or Recurrent Training after my leave of absence?
output: A Flight Attendant returning from a leave of absence who requires Requalification or Recurrent Training will not be required to wait for more than twenty-one (21) days to begin the training upon expiration of the leave. If the Company cannot accommodate the twenty-one (21) day requirement, the Flight Attendant will be placed on active payroll status on the twenty-first (21st) day.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13J General Leave of Absence

input: What happens if I fail to return to work at the end of my leave?
output: A Flight Attendant who fails to return to work at the expiration of a leave shall be considered as being on unauthorized leave and may be removed from the seniority list and administratively discharged.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13J General Leave of Absence

input: Can I engage in other outside employment while on leave?
output: A Flight Attendant on leave may engage in other outside employment provided that such employment does not present a conflict of interest as determined by the Vice President of Inflight or her designee.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13J General Leave of Absence

input: What are my pass travel privileges while on a specific type of leave?
output: The pass travel privileges of a Flight Attendant on Military Leave, Bereavement Leave, Union Leave, or Jury Duty Leave will be the same as if the Flight Attendant were an active Flight Attendant. A Flight Attendant on another type of leave who is medically cleared for air travel may request passes, on a case-by-case basis, and will not be unreasonably denied. The approval or denial will be made in writing, with a copy to the MEC President or designee.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 13J General Leave of Absence

input: What is the process for requesting a base transfer?
output: A Flight Attendant can request a base transfer by submitting an electronic bid before the tenth (10th) of each month stating the base, in order of preference, to which they desire to transfer. Transfers will be awarded in system seniority order and are effective two (2) months after posting.

input: What happens if a Flight Attendant is not awarded a transfer?
output: If a Flight Attendant is not awarded a transfer, they must submit a new transfer request before the tenth (10th) day of any calendar month. The electronic bidding procedure provides a method for submitting and confirming the bid.

input: How long does it take for transfers to be posted after the award is made?
output: Transfers are posted by the fifteenth (15th) day of each calendar month and are effective two (2) months after posting.

input: What happens if a Flight Attendant withdraws or changes their transfer request after the tenth (10th) of the calendar month?
output: Changes to or withdrawals of a transfer request are not allowed after the tenth (10th) of the calendar month in which the transfer request is submitted. The transfer award will be posted at each base.

input: What is a Closed Base Swap and how does it work?
output: A Closed Base Swap occurs when there are two (2) or more bases projected to be closed, and the Flight Attendant can submit a request electronically or via email to Crew Planning before the close of the Closed Base Swap bid. The swap will be completed and posted no later than the 15th of the month.

input: What happens if a Flight Attendant is awarded a Closed Base Swap?
output: Once awarded a Closed Base Swap, the Flight Attendant will transfer to the new base on the effective date and remain in that base until they are awarded a new base through a subsequent Closed Base Swap, vacancy award, or displacement. The swap will be awarded in system seniority order among those who have submitted Closed Base Swap bids.

input: What is the restriction on voluntary base transfers?
output: A Flight Attendant awarded a base transfer is precluded from further voluntary base transfers for four (4) months. The Company may waive this restriction due to extenuating circumstances.

input: How is scheduling coordinated for a duty-free period when moving as a result of a voluntary transfer?
output: The Company and the Flight Attendant shall coordinate the scheduling of a duty-free period in which to accomplish the move, subject to operational needs. If a previously scheduled trip falls within the moving period, the Flight Attendant may trade the trip, drop the trip(s), sit reserve during another part of the bid period, or use earned vacation time and/or personal day to compensate for the value of the missed trip(s).

input: What is the process for assigning new hire Flight Attendants to a base?
output: New hire Flight Attendants are assigned to a base after they complete Initial Operating Experience (“OE”). Transfers are awarded in accordance with Section 15.A. before the assignment of a new hire Flight Attendant.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 15B New Base Hire Assignments

input: How many days with pay are allowed for a Flight Attendant to relocate after successful completion of Initial Operating Experience?
output: After successful completion of Initial Operating Experience, a Flight Attendant is allowed a total of four (4) days with pay to relocate prior to being assigned to duty. These days will be clearly designated on the Flight Attendant’s schedule and include three (3) consecutive calendar days not involving travel.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 15B New Base Hire Assignments

input: Can I request a transfer to a different base before completing Initial Operating Experience?
output: No, transfers are awarded in accordance with Section 15.A. after completion of Initial Operating Experience. New hire Flight Attendants are assigned to a base based on company needs and seniority.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 15B New Base Hire Assignments

input: What are my rights if I am displaced from my base?
output: If you are displaced from your base, you have the opportunity to displace the most junior Flight Attendant at the base of your choice, provided that you have greater system seniority than that Flight Attendant. You may also elect to accept the displacement and its attendant provisions by notifying the Company within ten days after the displacement is announced.

input: How much notice must I be given if I am displaced from a base?
output: You must be given forty-five days’ notice of displacement from a base, or as required by law.

input: What are my options if an originally scheduled trip falls outside of the moving period?
output: If an originally scheduled trip falls outside of the moving period, you may forfeit the value of the trip for that day(s), elect time recoverable status for that day(s), use earned vacation time and/or personal day to compensate for the value of the day(s), or if possible, work the remaining portion of the originally scheduled trip(s).

input: How much travel time am I entitled to if I am displaced from my base?
output: If you are displaced from your base, you are allowed one day of travel for each four hundred (400) AAA miles or fraction thereof for the most direct route between your former base and newly assigned base.

input: What is a temporary assignment?
output: A temporary assignment is an assignment to a vacancy which is anticipated to last fewer than one hundred twenty (120) days.

input: How long must a vacancy be for it to be considered a permanent opening?
output: Any vacancy of one hundred twenty (120) days or more, or which has existed for more than one hundred twenty (120) days, shall be considered a permanent opening.

input: For how long can a temporary assignment last?
output: Temporary assignments shall be awarded or assigned for no longer than one (1) bid period unless otherwise agreed upon by the Company and the Union.

input: How are temporary assignments posted?
output: Temporary assignments shall be electronically posted. The number of Flight Attendants required, the equipment type to be used and the type of flying shall be outlined in the bid package.

input: How are temporary assignments awarded?
output: Temporary assignments shall be awarded in system seniority and assigned in inverse order of system seniority, unless there are staffing requirements which necessitate using Flight Attendants from a specific base or bases.

input: What transportation is provided for positioning of crews during temporary assignments?
output: The Company shall provide transportation in accordance with standard policies for positioning of crews in order to begin and end the temporary assignment. If a Flight Attendant requests, the Company may, subject to cost considerations, pay for the movement of a vehicle from the Flight Attendant’s residence or base at the beginning of the assignment and for the return at the conclusion of the assignment.

input: What accommodations are provided during temporary assignments?
output: The Company shall provide hotels and per diem for each calendar day assigned to the temporary position, excluding any calendar days in which the Flight Attendant is on vacation or the Flight Attendant returns to the Flight Attendant’s home or base.

input: What other expenses are covered during temporary assignments?
output: Other reasonable actual expenses related to the temporary assignment shall be paid with prior approval from the appropriate supervisor and shall be substantiated with receipts. Examples of “other reasonable expenses” include, but are not limited to, internet service (if not provided free of charge), dry cleaning, laundry, transportation to/from the grocery store (if not provided by the hotel) and business center expenses related to Flight Attendant duties.

input: What is the process for involuntary furlough?
output: The Company shall notify the Union prior to official announcement and implementation of a furlough of Flight Attendants.

input: How are Flight Attendants furloughed in inverse order of system seniority?
output: A Flight Attendant will be furloughed in inverse order of system seniority.

input: What is the minimum notice period required for a furlough?
output: The Company will provide at least thirty (30) days’ notice of furlough (unless more notice is required by law) or pay in lieu thereof for each day the notice is less than thirty (30) days.

input: What benefits do Flight Attendants retain while on furlough for fewer than ninety (90) days?
output: A Flight Attendant will retain all eligible benefits as outlined in Section 18 Benefits and will continue to accrue longevity for benefit purposes.

input: How long can a furloughed Flight Attendant retain seniority and longevity accrued prior to the time of furlough?
output: A furloughed Flight Attendant shall retain all seniority and longevity accrued prior to the time of furlough for a period not to exceed six (6) years.

input: What happens to a Flight Attendant who remains on furlough at the end of six (6) years from the effective date of furlough?
output: A Flight Attendant who remains on furlough at the end of six (6) years from the effective date of furlough shall be released from employment with the Company and the Flight Attendant’s name will be deleted from the FlightAttendant System Seniority List.

input: What benefits do furloughed Flight Attendants retain for 90 days?
output: A furloughed Flight Attendant shall retain the same medical, dental and life insurance on the same terms and at the same Flight Attendant contribution rates as Flight Attendants on active status for 90 days.

input: What pass privileges do furloughed Flight Attendants have for one year?
output: A furloughed Flight Attendant shall retain on-line space available pass privileges for one year.

input: Can I ask for a voluntary personal furlough (VPF) if I am not facing an involuntary furlough?
output: No, VPF is only offered prior to an involuntary furlough of Flight Attendants. It will be administered on the same basis as an involuntary furlough.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 16B Voluntary Personal Furlough Program

input: How is VPF awarded if I am eligible for it?
output: VPF will be awarded by system seniority, which means that you will retain your seniority and longevity accrued prior to the time of VPF for a period not exceeding six years. You will also continue to accrue bid seniority while on VPF.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 16B Voluntary Personal Furlough Program

input: How long can I stay on VPF?
output: The Company will determine specific time periods and target numbers available by base at the conclusion of the specified voluntary furlough period. If an additional period is available, you may bid for an extension of the voluntary furlough period or return to duty.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 16B Voluntary Personal Furlough Program

input: What happens to my insurance and travel benefits while on VPF?
output: You will retain applicable employee insurance and travel benefits and must continue to pay any employee portion of such benefits during the voluntary furlough period.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 16B Voluntary Personal Furlough Program

input: Can I be recalled from VPF before the announced end date?
output: Yes, you may be recalled prior to the announced end date by the procedures outlined in Section 16. However, VPF Flight Attendants shall be recalled after all Flight Attendants on involuntary furlough have been recalled.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 16B Voluntary Personal Furlough Program

input: What is the process for recalling furloughed Flight Attendants?
output: The process for recalling furloughed Flight Attendants involves going through the entire furlough list in order of seniority to fill the company’s needs. If there are not enough Flight Attendants who accept recall, the company will recall in reverse order of system seniority, advising each Flight Attendant that they must accept said recall or risk loss of employment.

input: How long is a Flight Attendant placed on the payroll after returning from furlough?
output: A Flight Attendant returning from furlough shall be placed on the payroll for a minimum of sixty (60) days.

input: What happens if the company cannot contact a furloughed Flight Attendant for recall or if the Flight Attendant does not notify Inflight Services of their response to recall by the deadline date?
output: If the Company is unable to contact a furloughed Flight Attendant for recall or if the Flight Attendant does not notify Inflight Services of their response to recall by the deadline date, the Company will consider the Flight Attendant to have deferred recall. The Flight Attendant will not be eligible for reassignment to duty until the next recall order is issued.

input: What happens if a Flight Attendant is recalled and there are no Flight Attendants with less seniority on furlough status?
output: If a Flight Attendant is recalled and there are no Flight Attendants with less seniority on furlough status, the Flight Attendant may apply for medical leave.

input: What happens to a Flight Attendant who is furloughed prior to completion of their probationary period?
output: A Flight Attendant who is furloughed prior to completion of their probationary period shall complete the balance of the probationary period upon return to active status.

input: What happens to a Flight Attendant who remains on furlough for more than six years?
output: A Flight Attendant who remains on furlough for more than six years shall be released from employment but may be eligible for rehire by the Company.

input: Can I get reimbursed for my moving expenses if I am required to change my base location due to a base reduction?
output: Yes, you may be eligible for reimbursement of your moving expenses if you are displaced from a base due to a base reduction.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 17A Qualifying for Moving Expenses

input: What if I am recalled from an involuntary furlough to a new base? Can I get reimbursed for my moving expenses then?
output: Yes, if you are recalled from an involuntary furlough to a new base, and the new base is at least 50 AAA miles away from your former base, you may be eligible for reimbursement of your moving expenses.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 17A Qualifying for Moving Expenses

input: I am on a temporary assignment that has been extended. Can I get reimbursed for my moving expenses in this case?
output: If your temporary assignment has been extended and you are required to move to a new base, you may be eligible for reimbursement of your moving expenses if the new base is at least 50 AAA miles away from your former base.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 17A Qualifying for Moving Expenses

input: How far does my former base need to be from the new base in order for me to qualify for moving expenses?
output: Your former base must be at least 50 AAA miles away from the new base for you to be eligible for reimbursement of your moving expenses.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 17A Qualifying for Moving Expenses

input: Can I get reimbursed for my moving expenses if I move from my residence to the new base?
output: The Company will pay moving expenses under this Section for the exclusive purpose of a move from a previous base to the new base or from your residence to the new base, whichever is shorter.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 17A Qualifying for Moving Expenses

input: What are the maximum moving expenses that I can be reimbursed for?
output: The Company will reimburse reasonable and actual moving expenses up to a maximum of six thousand dollars ($6,000).

input: What items are covered under the moving expenses?
output: Covered moving expenses include the cost of packing, crating, unpacking, boxes and utility, power, cable and telephone initial connection charges, including deposits; temporary storage up to thirty (30) days; insurance coverage for moving personal and household effects; expenses for either driving or shipment for one (1) personally owned automobile; reasonable enroute expenses for a Flight Attendant and their family members incurred for meals and lodging; and any other expense that has received prior approval from the Vice President of Inflight or designee.

input: Are there any expenses that do not require receipts?
output: Covered moving expenses up to an amount of one thousand dollars ($1,000) do not require receipts. To the extent that receipts are not provided for covered moving expenses up to one thousand dollars ($1,000), payment for those expenses shall be treated as taxable income in accordance with IRS regulations.

input: Can I get an advance on my moving expenses?
output: Yes, you can request an advance of up to one thousand dollars ($1,000) for allowable moving expenses for Company-paid moves. Such advance requests must be made at least ten (10) days prior to the relocation and must subsequently be reconciled within thirty (30) days of the advance with proper receipts for covered expenses except as provided for in Paragraph C.2. above. All advances must be approved by the Vice President of Inflight or designee.

input: How long do I have to submit my moving expense receipts?
output: You must submit all receipts within ninety (90) days after the date that the charge was incurred, and the moving expenses will be reimbursed via direct deposit within twenty (20) days of receipt submission.

input: What happens if I do not have direct deposit?
output: If you do not have direct deposit, your reimbursement will be via trackable delivery, mailed/shipped within twenty (20) days of submission of receipts.

input: What happens if I choose not to relocate after being eligible for moving expenses?
output: If you are eligible for moving expenses and choose not to relocate, you will receive one thousand dollars ($1,000) toward defraying commuting costs.

input: Can you please confirm that the MEC President or designee and the MEC Air Safety Chairperson are included in the company’s emergency response plan call list?
output: Yes, according to the contract, the Company shall include the MEC President or designee and the MEC Air Safety Chairperson on the Company’s emergency response plan call list.

input: What is the protocol for notifying the MEC President or designee when a Flight Attendant is injured during the performance of their duties as a result of an incident or accident?
output: The Company shall notify the MEC President or designee as soon as possible any time a Flight Attendant is injured during the performance of their duties as a result of an incident or accident as defined by the National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB).

input: What is the procedure for notifying the Union about incidents or accidents involving Company aircraft?
output: The Company shall notify the MEC President or designee as soon as possible of an incident or accident as defined by the NTSB. The Company shall also provide the Union with copies of Flight Attendant written reports of such incident or accident. These reports are to be considered as internal documents and are not for distribution.

input: How does the Company ensure that appropriate Union officials have access to an accident site involving Company aircraft?
output: The Company shall make every effort to obtain the necessary credentials required for Union access to an accident site involving Company aircraft. Appropriate Union officials shall be released from duty as necessary.

input: Can you confirm that we have a monthly meeting scheduled with the company to discuss safety concerns?
output: Yes, the Company and Union are required to meet monthly to discuss any safety and health concerns raised by the Union representative(s). The meetings should last no longer than 60 minutes, and each party may keep minutes of the meetings.

input: Will the MEC Safety Chairperson be invited to attend the upcoming FAA emergency evacuation demonstrations?
output: Yes, the MEC Safety Chairperson or a Union qualified designee will be invited to attend Company-FAA emergency evacuation demonstrations or partial demonstrations of airplanes that the Company plans to operate.

input: Are there any expenses associated with the Union attending safety meetings?
output: The Company will not incur any expenses as a result of the Union attending safety meetings unless expressly authorized by the Company.

input: Will the company consider our recommendations on matters affecting safety, health and security of Flight Attendants?
output: Yes, the Company shall consider the recommendation of the AFA Safety Committee on all matters affecting the safety, health and security of Flight Attendants.

input: What are the company’s responsibilities regarding environmental hazards that flight attendants may be exposed to while on duty?
output: The Company shall notify Flight Attendants upon confirmation of any environmental hazard to which they may be exposed while on duty. The Company shall make every reasonable effort to standardize the configuration of safety or emergency equipment on each series of aircraft as appropriate, except when cabin structure changes are necessary.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 20C General Health and Safety

input: What happens if the company wants to change the class of service, galley, or seating reconfiguration?
output: The Company shall confer with the MEC President, MEC Safety Chairperson or designee before initiating a major change in class of service, galley, or seating reconfiguration. The Union acknowledges this information is proprietary and confidential and that no such information designated by the Company as confidential may be disclosed to any person or entity.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 20C General Health and Safety

input: What happens if there are concerns about inflight safety regarding a new aircraft type?
output: The Company shall notify the MEC Safety Chairperson and MEC President of a decision to add a new aircraft type for its fleet. Upon request, the Company shall meet and confer with the AFA Safety Committee members to discuss inflight safety concerns regarding the new aircraft type.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 20C General Health and Safety

input: How can flight attendants access Material Safety Data Sheets?
output: Material Safety Data Sheets for all chemicals used to clean, disinfect, exterminate, seal, or otherwise treat aircraft interiors shall be available to the Union for review upon request. The Company will make available online the Material Safety Data Sheets for all chemicals to which Flight Attendants may be exposed while performing their duties.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 20C General Health and Safety

input: What is the company’s policy on assault and/or interference involving crewmembers?
output: The Company will ensure that all passengers on IOM and/or Hadj flights have had all appropriate medical screening and that any necessary safeguards for Flight Attendants have been implemented. All such flights will first be put in open time, time permitting, with a notation that this is an IOM or Hadj flight. If there are no bidders through open time, the Company will then go to the standing volunteer list which is maintained specifically for these special flights. If there are no volunteers, then the Company may assign the pairing in inverse order of system seniority.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 20C General Health and Safety

input: What happens if a bomb threat or threat of similarly dangerous material is received by the company?
output: A Flight Attendant shall not be required to perform a bomb search or search a similarly dangerous material, other than in-flight, and shall not be required to work on any flight for which they were scheduled to work within 24 hours after the threat was made. The Company will make every effort to provide an alternate flight for the Flight Attendant(s) involved.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 20C General Health and Safety

input: What happens if there is a critical incident involving a flight attendant?
output: Under any of these circumstances, the Company may invoke its Critical Incident Review Policy. If appropriate, the Flight Attendant will be positioned to their base as soon as possible following debrief of the situation, if necessary, and any required participation in an agency or law enforcement investigation.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 20C General Health and Safety

input: Can I file a grievance if I have concerns about my schedule or assignment?
output: Yes, you can file a grievance if you have concerns about your schedule or assignment. As a Flight Attendant covered under this Agreement, you have the right to file a grievance concerning any action of the Company affecting you. The Company will thoroughly and expeditiously investigate your grievance.

input: What should I do before filing a grievance?
output: Before filing a grievance or Complaint Resolution Form (CRF), you are encouraged to discuss any concerns with a Flight Attendant Manager and/or Union representative. This will give you the opportunity to resolve your issue informally, without having to go through the formal grievance process.

input: How long should it take to dispose of grievances or complaints?
output: The Company and the Union will make every effort to keep to a minimum the actual time spent in disposing of grievances, disputes, or complaints. The goal is to resolve these issues as quickly and efficiently as possible.

input: What is the process for filing a non-disciplinary dispute?
output: If you have a non-disciplinary dispute with the Company, you must use a Complaint Resolution Form (CRF) in an attempt to resolve the issue prior to filing a grievance. The CRF should be filed with the Company no later than sixty (60) days after you have, or reasonably should have had, knowledge of the matter giving rise to your concern or complaint. The Union will submit the CRF to the Vice President of Inflight or designee, with a copy to the Vice President, Labor Relations or designee. The Company must respond in writing within thirty (30) days from the date of submission. If the response is unsatisfactory or if the Company fails to respond within the time limits, you may file a grievance and it will be considered timely if filed within thirty (30) days from the date the Company response was due.

input: What should I do if I disagree with the Company’s response to my CRF?
output: If you dispute the Company’s response to your Complaint Resolution Form (CRF), you must, within thirty (30) days of the date the Company’s response was due, make a written request on a grievance form to the Vice President of Inflight or designee, with a copy to the Vice President, Labor Relations or designee, for an investigation and review of your grievance. The grievance form should set forth a complete statement of the facts out of which the grievance arose, the provision(s) of the Agreement upon which the grievance is based, if applicable, and the relief sought. Your grievance will be reviewed at the next monthly grievance meeting.

input: When are monthly grievance resolution meetings held?
output: Monthly grievance resolution meetings will be held during the second week of the month, or as mutually agreed upon, for discussion of and to attempt to resolve all pending grievances. The meetings shall be held in the city where the general offices of the Company are located or at an alternative location mutually agreed upon by the parties.

input: How long will it take for a grievance to be resolved at a monthly meeting?
output: Each grievance discussed at a Monthly Meeting will either be granted, settled or denied by no later than thirty (30) calendar days following such Monthly Meeting. The Union grievance representatives shall be responsible for informing the grievant of the outcome of the review of their grievance at the Monthly Meeting.

input: What can I do if I’m not satisfied with the Company’s response at a monthly meeting?
output: If you are not satisfied with the Company’s response at a monthly meeting, the Union may appeal the response to the System Board of Adjustment. This is an additional step in the grievance process that can be taken if you wish to pursue your grievance further.

input: Can you provide me with more information about the investigation process for flight attendants?
output: Certainly! In no event will a Flight Attendant be disciplined or discharged from the Company without a thorough, impartial and expeditious investigation of the alleged charge. A Flight Attendant shall not be issued an NOI later than ninety (90) days from the date Inflight management knew, or reasonably should have known, of the reasonable basis for discipline. Time limits may be extended by mutual agreement between the parties.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C1 Notice of Investigation NOI

input: What should I expect in terms of notification when an investigation is initiated?
output: The Company will provide a written NOI to a Flight Attendant with a copy to the Union. The written notice shall include the subject matter or precise nature giving rise to such investigation. Prior to the meeting, the Company will provide the Union with any and all documents in its possession that it intends to use to support its position in discipline or discharge. Such documents may be redacted. Notices of Investigation, discipline and/or discharge under this Section will be issued to the Flight Attendant by any of the following methods: hand delivery, email to the Flight Attendant’s Company email address, certified mail, or express delivery. The Union will be notified via email, using an address provided by the Union.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C1 Notice of Investigation NOI

input: How will I be compensated if I am required to attend an NOI meeting in person?
output: If you are required by the Company to attend your NOI meeting in person, you will be pay protected for any trip(s) dropped to accommodate your attendance at the meeting. However, you will not be pay protected for any trip(s) that were voluntarily added to your schedule after the NOI was scheduled.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C1 Notice of Investigation NOI

input: What if I am required to attend the NOI meeting on my day off?
output: If you are required by the Company to attend your NOI meeting on a day off, you will receive four (4) hours of pay for attending the meeting in person, or one (1) hour of pay for attending the meeting virtually.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C1 Notice of Investigation NOI

input: Can you confirm that I have five calendar days to schedule an NOI meeting after receiving the notice?
output: Yes, that’s correct. You have five calendar days to schedule the NOI meeting after receiving the notice.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C2 Notice of Investigation Meeting

input: Will the investigative meeting be held at my base or can it be conducted over the phone?
output: The investigative meeting can be in person or telephonic with reasonable effort used to secure testimony from witnesses. Every effort will be made to conduct all investigative meetings at your base. If circumstances dictate that the investigative meeting must be held out of the base, you will be paid for trips missed or four (4) hours per day above the guarantee on your day off.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C2 Notice of Investigation Meeting

input: I want to secure Union Representation for the NOI meeting. How soon should I do this?
output: You may secure Union Representation at any time before the investigative meeting. It is recommended that you schedule the meeting within five (5) calendar days of the Company’s issuance of the NOI to ensure that it is held within fourteen (14) calendar days of the Company’s issuance of the NOI, or as mutually agreed by the Parties.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C2 Notice of Investigation Meeting

input: What happens if I fail to schedule the meeting within the five-day time frame?
output: If you fail to schedule the meeting within the five-day time frame, the Company may schedule the investigative meeting and will notify you and the Union of the date and time of the meeting. Any additional postponement will result in loss of pay if you are held out of service.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C2 Notice of Investigation Meeting

input: Can I choose to be represented by another employee if Union Representation is unavailable?
output: Yes, you may choose to be represented by another employee if Union Representation is unavailable.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C2 Notice of Investigation Meeting

input: How long does the Company have to notify me of any discipline or discharge action after the NOI meeting?
output: Within fifteen (15) days of the conclusion of the NOI meeting, the Company will notify you and the Union, in writing, of any discipline or discharge action intended by the Company. Should the Company wish to continue the investigation for more than fifteen (15) days after the NOI meeting, it will notify the Union prior to the end of the fifteen (15) days. In no event will the decision take longer than twenty (20) days from the date of the NOI meeting.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C2 Notice of Investigation Meeting

input: What factors does the Company consider when assessing discipline?
output: In assessing discipline, the Company will consider the gravity of the offense, seniority, and the work record of the employee involved.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C2 Notice of Investigation Meeting

input: What is the time frame for scheduling an NOI meeting?
output: The Flight Attendant must schedule the meeting within five (5) calendar days of the Company’s issuance of the NOI, and the meeting must be held within fourteen (14) calendar days of the Company’s issuance of the NOI, or as mutually agreed by the Parties.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C2 Notice of Investigation Meeting

input: Can a Flight Attendant secure Union Representation for the NOI meeting?
output: Yes, the Flight Attendant may secure Union Representation for the NOI meeting.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C2 Notice of Investigation Meeting

input: What happens if the Flight Attendant fails to schedule the meeting within the five (5) calendar day time frame?
output: The Company may schedule the investigative meeting and will notify the Flight Attendant and Union of the date and time of the meeting.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C2 Notice of Investigation Meeting

input: Can the NOI meeting be in person or telephonic?
output: Yes, the meeting can be in person or telephonic with reasonable effort used to secure testimony from witnesses.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C2 Notice of Investigation Meeting

input: What happens if there is a postponement after the initial meeting has been scheduled?
output: Any additional postponement will result in loss of pay if the Flight Attendant is held out of service.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C2 Notice of Investigation Meeting

input: Can you please clarify the process for investigating a flight attendant for a violation?
output: The Company will assess the gravity of the offense, seniority, and work record of the employee involved in determining the appropriate course of action. This may include holding the Flight Attendant out of service with pay for up to 72 hours while conducting an investigation. If no violation is charged within that timeframe, the Flight Attendant must be returned to service and made whole.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C2 Notice of Investigation Meeting

input: What are the consequences if a flight attendant tests positive for alcohol or drugs?
output: The Company reserves the right to hold a Flight Attendant out of service without pay following a positive alcohol or drug test result. This is separate from the 72-hour investigation period with pay, during which the Company must either charge the Flight Attendant with a violation or return them to service and make them whole.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C2 Notice of Investigation Meeting

input: How does the company determine the appropriate disciplinary action for a flight attendant?
output: The Company considers various factors when determining disciplinary action, including the gravity of the offense, seniority, and work record of the employee involved. These factors are assessed on a case-by-case basis to ensure fairness and consistency in the disciplinary process.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C2 Notice of Investigation Meeting

input: Can you provide guidance on how to handle an incident involving a flight attendant who is under the influence of alcohol or drugs?
output: In the event of an incident involving a Flight Attendant who is under the influence of alcohol or drugs, it is important to follow company protocols and report the matter immediately. The Company will then take appropriate action based on the severity of the situation and the specific circumstances involved.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C2 Notice of Investigation Meeting

input: What are the options available for addressing a Flight Attendant who violates company policies?
output: The Company may choose to hold a Flight Attendant out of service with pay for up to 72 hours during an investigation, after which they must either be charged with a violation or returned to service and made whole. Depending on the circumstances, additional disciplinary action may also be taken, such as a written warning or suspension without pay.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C2 Notice of Investigation Meeting

input: How does seniority impact the disciplinary process for flight attendants?
output: Seniority is one of several factors considered by the Company when determining appropriate disciplinary action for a Flight Attendant. It is not the sole determinant, but rather one component of a comprehensive assessment that takes into account the gravity of the offense and the employee’s work record as well.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C2 Notice of Investigation Meeting

input: What is the timeframe for notification of discipline or discharge actions after an NOI meeting?
output: The Company is required to notify the Flight Attendant and the Union in writing within fifteen (15) days of the conclusion of the NOI meeting if it intends to take any discipline or discharge action. If the investigation needs to continue beyond fifteen (15) days, the Company must notify the Union before the end of that time period. The decision should be made within twenty (20) days from the date of the NOI meeting.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C2 Notice of Investigation Meeting

input: What information should be included in the written notice of discipline or discharge?
output: The written notice of discipline or discharge should contain a precise description of the charge(s) against the Flight Attendant, and should be sent to the Flight Attendant with a copy to the Union. This ensures that both parties are aware of the intended action and can respond accordingly.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C2 Notice of Investigation Meeting

input: What happens if the Company decides not to take any discipline or discharge action after an NOI meeting?
output: If there is no intended discipline or discharge action, the Flight Attendant should be made whole and the Union notified in writing. This ensures that all parties are aware of the final outcome and can move forward accordingly.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C2 Notice of Investigation Meeting

input: Can you provide guidance on how to handle a situation where an investigation extends beyond the initial fifteen (15) days after an NOI meeting?
output: If an investigation needs to continue beyond the initial fifteen (15) days after an NOI meeting, the Company must notify the Union prior to the end of that time period. The Company should make every effort to conclude the investigation and reach a decision as soon as possible, while still ensuring due process is followed.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C2 Notice of Investigation Meeting

input: What are the consequences if the Company fails to meet the twenty (20) day deadline for making a decision after an NOI meeting?
output: If the Company fails to make a decision within twenty (20) days from the date of the NOI meeting, it may be considered a breach of contract and subject to grievance procedures. It is important for the Company to adhere to established timelines to ensure fairness and consistency in the disciplinary process.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C2 Notice of Investigation Meeting

input: How does the Union become involved in the disciplinary process for flight attendants?
output: The Union plays a significant role in representing Flight Attendants during the disciplinary process. They are notified of any intended discipline or discharge actions, and have the opportunity to respond on behalf of the Flight Attendant. This collaboration helps ensure that due process is followed and that all parties involved are treated fairly.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22C2 Notice of Investigation Meeting

input: How can I file a grievance if I disagree with a disciplinary action taken against me?
output: You can file a written grievance to the Vice President of Inflight or designee within thirty (30) calendar days of receiving the Company’s written notice of discipline. A copy should also be sent to the Vice President, Labor Relations or designee. The grievance will be heard in accordance with the outlined process.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22D Grievances Involving Discipline and Discharge

input: Who should I address my grievance to?
output: You should address your grievance to the Vice President of Inflight or designee. Additionally, send a copy to the Vice President, Labor Relations or designee.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22D Grievances Involving Discipline and Discharge

input: What is the timeframe for filing a grievance if I disagree with a disciplinary action?
output: You have thirty (30) calendar days from receiving the Company’s written notice of discipline to file a written grievance to the Vice President of Inflight or designee, with a copy to the Vice President, Labor Relations or designee.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22D Grievances Involving Discipline and Discharge

input: How will my grievance be heard if I decide to appeal a disciplinary action?
output: Your grievance will be heard in accordance with the outlined process, which includes addressing it to the appropriate management personnel and providing a copy of the grievance to the Vice President, Labor Relations or designee.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22D Grievances Involving Discipline and Discharge

input: Can I file a grievance if I have been discharged from my position as a Flight Attendant?
output: Yes, you can file a written grievance within thirty (30) calendar days of receiving the Company’s written notice of discharge, addressed to the Vice President of Inflight or designee, with a copy to the Vice President, Labor Relations or designee. The grievance will be heard in accordance with the outlined process.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22D Grievances Involving Discipline and Discharge

input: What happens after I file a grievance regarding disciplinary action or discharge?
output: After filing a grievance within thirty (30) calendar days of receiving the Company’s written notice of discipline or discharge, the grievance will be heard in accordance with the outlined process. This includes addressing it to the appropriate management personnel and providing a copy of the grievance to the Vice President, Labor Relations or designee.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22D Grievances Involving Discipline and Discharge

input: Can I appeal the Company’s decision if I am dissatisfied with the outcome of my grievance?
output: If you are dissatisfied with the outcome of your grievance, you may have the option to appeal the Company’s decision, following the appropriate procedures outlined in the collective bargaining agreement.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22D Grievances Involving Discipline and Discharge

input: Can you please confirm the date of the next quarterly mediation meeting?
output: The next quarterly mediation meeting is scheduled for the third week of April.

input: Who is allowed to attend the mediation proceedings?
output: The grievant(s) and their Union Representative(s), as well as individuals needed to present the parties’ position with authority to reach an agreement and bind their respective party, are allowed to attend the mediation proceedings. Non-participating observers will not be permitted except by mutual agreement of the parties.

input: What is the purpose of the mediation process?
output: The mediation process is intended to be informal with a focus on resolving grievances if possible.

input: Is the record of the mediation confidential?
output: Yes, the record of the mediation shall be confidential and inadmissible in any subsequent proceeding unless a written settlement is reached.

input: What happens to the written material presented during the mediation if no settlement is reached?
output: Written material presented to the other party shall be returned to the party presenting the material at the termination of the mediation if no settlement is reached.

input: Are there any restrictions on referencing the mediation process or statements made during it in future proceedings?
output: In the event a grievance that was the subject of mediation under this paragraph is subsequently heard before the System Board of Adjustment, neither party may make any reference to the fact the grievance was the subject of mediation and there shall be no reference to any statements made, documents provided, or actions taken by either party during the mediation unless the party offering such statements, documents or actions did have, or would have had, access or entitlement to such statements, documents or actions outside of the mediation.

input: Does scheduling a grievance for mediation waive any procedural arguments?
output: By agreeing to schedule a grievance for mediation, the parties do not waive any procedural argument(s) they may have regarding the grievance. Both the Company and the Union reserve the right to raise jurisdictional or procedural issues notwithstanding their agreement to schedule such grievance for mediation.

input: What are the rules for presenting grievances at a mediation session?
output: Only mutually agreed-upon grievances can be presented at a mediation session, which will be held in the city where the Company’s general offices are located unless otherwise agreed upon.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22F Grievance Mediation with Mediator

input: Who provides mediators for grievance mediation proceedings?
output: Mediators will be provided by the National Mediation Board.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22F Grievance Mediation with Mediator

input: How are mediation fees and expenses handled?
output: The parties will share equally the cost of mediation fees, expenses, conference facilities, and materials. Each party is responsible for the costs and expenses of their participants in mediation. In the case of a terminated grievant, the Company will provide non-revenue travel accommodations for attendance at mediation, with the Union and Company coordinating the arrangements.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22F Grievance Mediation with Mediator

input: When do mediation sessions take place?
output: Mediation sessions are held in February and September, with additional sessions possible if agreed upon by both parties and the mediator.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22F Grievance Mediation with Mediator

input: What is the scope of issues that can be mediated?
output: The issue mediated must be the same as the one not resolved through the grievance or mediation process under paragraph E, and new evidence can be presented during mediation.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22F Grievance Mediation with Mediator

input: Are there any limitations on presenting evidence during mediation?
output: The rules of evidence do not apply in mediation, but no transcript of the mediation conference will be made. Each party will submit a brief oral statement at the beginning of the session.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22F Grievance Mediation with Mediator

input: Who can attend a mediation conference?
output: Attendees include individuals needed to present each party’s position and reach agreement with binding authority. Non-participating observers are not allowed without mutual agreement from both parties.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22F Grievance Mediation with Mediator

input: Who are the principal spokespersons for each party in a mediation conference?
output: The Company and Union will each appoint a principal spokesperson, who may be an attorney, to represent their respective positions during the mediation conference.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22F Grievance Mediation with Mediator

input: How is the mediation process conducted?
output: The mediation process is informal, with the mediator having the authority to meet jointly and separately with the parties but no power to compel resolution. The mediator’s jurisdiction does not extend to changes in pay rates, rules, or working conditions.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22F Grievance Mediation with Mediator

input: What happens if a settlement is not reached during mediation?
output: If no settlement is reached, the mediator will provide an immediate oral advisory decision, which can be mutually agreed upon for adoption. The opinion won’t constitute a precedent unless both parties agree in writing.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22F Grievance Mediation with Mediator

input: Can a mediator who participated in a mediation session later serve as an arbitrator or witness in System Board proceedings?
output: A mediator cannot serve as an arbitrator or witness in System Board proceedings if a grievance not settled during the mediation session is heard. No reference to the mediation can be made during System Board proceedings, except for statements, documents, or actions that would have been accessible outside of mediation.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22F Grievance Mediation with Mediator

input: Do parties waive any procedural arguments by agreeing to a mediation conference?
output: Agreeing to a mediation conference does not waive any procedural arguments. Both the Company and Union reserve the right to raise jurisdictional or procedural issues, even with the agreement to schedule a conference.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22F Grievance Mediation with Mediator

input: How are settlements recorded during a mediation session?
output: Settlements reached during mediation should be reduced to writing and signed by the parties before the end of the day’s session, unless mutually agreed upon to extend the time needed for documentation.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22F Grievance Mediation with Mediator

input: How can I file a grievance?
output: You can file a grievance by sending an email to the appropriate representative.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22G General Grievance Procedure and System Board

input: Can a Union representative be present during the grievance process?
output: Yes, a Flight Attendant may request to have a Union representative present in person or by telephone during the Monthly Meeting and any subsequent step in the grievance process where their presence is required.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22G General Grievance Procedure and System Board

input: What are my rights if I face discipline or discharge?
output: You have the right to request a Union representative to be present during any meeting with Company officials concerning your discipline or discharge. The Company will make a good faith effort to remind you of this opportunity. In unusual circumstances, the Union may request to have more than one representative present.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22G General Grievance Procedure and System Board

input: Can the time limits for the grievance process be extended?
output: Yes, the time limits can be extended by mutual agreement between the parties involved.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22G General Grievance Procedure and System Board

input: What happens if the decision made by the Company is not appealed within the prescribed time limits?
output: If the decision is not appealed within the prescribed time limits, it becomes final and binding.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22G General Grievance Procedure and System Board

input: What should I do if the Company fails to reply within the prescribed time limits?
output: You may move to the next step in the grievance process if the Company fails to reply within the prescribed time limits.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22G General Grievance Procedure and System Board

input: What happens if a Flight Attendant is exonerated after an appeal?
output: If a Flight Attendant is exonerated, they will be reinstated without loss of seniority and paid for the period of time held out of service. Their record will also be cleared of any disciplinary material.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22G General Grievance Procedure and System Board

input: How can I act as a representative or witness for another Flight Attendant?
output: The Company shall permit you sufficient time from duty to act as a representative or witness, subject to operational needs. Testimony may be given telephonically.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22G General Grievance Procedure and System Board

input: What documents should I expect to receive before a Monthly Meeting?
output: At least three business days prior to a Monthly Meeting and upon written request, each party shall produce copies of relevant documents related to any grievance scheduled to be discussed at the meeting.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22G General Grievance Procedure and System Board

input: What is the purpose of the System Board of Adjustment?
output: The purpose of the Spirit Airlines Flight Attendant System Board of Adjustment is to adjust and decide disputes that may arise out of the interpretation and/or application of the Agreement or an alleged violation of the Agreement, or disciplinary or discharge action taken against a Flight Attendant.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22H System Board of Adjustment

input: What is the process for filing an appeal with the System Board?
output: An appeal to the System Board shall be filed in writing to the System Board Chairman with copies to the Company’s Vice President of Inflight or designee, with a copy to the Vice President, Labor Relations or designee, within 180 days of the Monthly Meeting decision. The appeal should include: a. The question at issue; b. Statement of the facts; c. Position of the grievant; and d. Position of the Company.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22H System Board of Adjustment

input: Who are the members of the System Board?
output: For each arbitration hearing held by the System Board, the Board shall consist of three (3) Board Members: A Union representative, a Company representative, and an arbitrator. All Board Members, except the arbitrator, shall be full-time Company employees. The arbitrator will serve as the Chairperson of the Board.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22H System Board of Adjustment

input: How is an arbitrator appointed for a particular arbitration?
output: The appointment of an arbitrator to serve with the Board Members for a particular arbitration shall be by mutual agreement between the parties from the panel described in Paragraph d. below or, if the parties are unable to reach agreement within fourteen (14) days of the Board’s receipt of a grievance, by the alternate strike method whereby each party shall alternately strike the name of a panel member with the last remaining panel member being the neutral arbitrator for the subject arbitration. Said striking must occur, if at all, within twenty-one (21) days of the Board’s receipt of a submission.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22H System Board of Adjustment

input: What is the process for conducting arbitration hearings?
output: Arbitration hearings shall be conducted in the city where the Company is headquartered unless the Company and the Union mutually agree to an alternate location. Both parties shall submit their version of a statement of issue to the other party no later than the day prior to the arbitration hearing. Both parties should utilize joint exhibits whenever possible. The number of witnesses called may not interfere with the operational needs of the Company.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 22H System Board of Adjustment

input: Can I wear my uniform while occupying the jumpseat when traveling for personal reasons?
output: No, you are not required to wear your uniform in this situation. However, you should adhere to the interline dress code as outlined in the Spirit Employee Handbook and wear your Company identification badge above the waist and visible at all times.

input: What are my jumpseat rights for personal travel?
output: As a Flight Attendant, you have priority for available cabin jumpseats on Company aircraft. You can reserve these jumpseats for personal travel on a first-come, first-served basis. However, operational needs may sometimes supersede your jumpseat rights if critical operational personnel are needed.

input: Does the company have agreements with other airlines for Flight Attendant jumpseats?
output: Yes, the Company will attempt to enter into Reciprocal Flight Attendant Jumpseat/Cabin Agreements with other airlines to provide additional options for personal travel.

input: What is the policy for providing crew snacks?
output: Crew snacks will be provided when a scheduled duty period exceeds eight (8) hours and there is no scheduled ground time greater than 1:15 during such duty period.

input: What is the policy for providing meals or snacks to Flight Attendants and pilots on the same pairing?
output: When Flight Attendants and pilots are on the same pairing, Flight Attendants shall be provided snacks or meals of the same quality whenever provided to pilots.

input: Can you confirm that we are not responsible for cleaning seat pockets, tray tables, and lavatories during our flight?
output: Yes, that is correct. Aircraft tidying does not include cleaning of seat pockets, tray tables, and lavatories. Flight Attendants are only responsible for maintaining general tidiness throughout the course of the flight.

input: What is considered the course of a flight for tidiness purposes?
output: The course of a flight for tidiness purposes means from block out to block in.

input: Are we responsible for removing trash from the aircraft during our flight?
output: No, Flight Attendants are not required to remove trash from the aircraft. Their responsibility is to maintain general tidiness throughout the course of the flight by collecting newspapers and magazines and other trash (from passengers or those that protrude from the seatback pockets) and replenishing lavatory supplies.

input: Can we take any actions to ensure that our assigned tasks do not interfere with our required safety duties?
output: Yes, it is important that aircraft tidying does not interfere with the performance of required safety duties. Flight Attendants should prioritize their safety responsibilities at all times.

input: What is the process for updating my contact information?
output: You can update your contact information by notifying Inflight Base Management and electronically updating the ESS system.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 23R Notification of Changes to Contact Information

input: How do I notify Inflight Base Management of changes to my contact information?
output: You can notify Inflight Base Management through email or phone call, providing them with the updated information.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 23R Notification of Changes to Contact Information

input: Is there a specific format I should follow when notifying Inflight Base Management of changes to my contact information?
output: No, there is no specific format required. However, it’s important to provide all necessary details and ensure that the information is accurate.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 23R Notification of Changes to Contact Information

input: How long does it take for the update to be reflected in the ESS system after I notify Inflight Base Management of changes to my contact information?
output: The update should be reflected in the ESS system within 24 hours after Inflight Base Management receives your notification.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 23R Notification of Changes to Contact Information

input: What happens if I fail to update my contact information with Inflight Base Management and it remains outdated in the ESS system?
output: If your contact information remains outdated in the ESS system, it may cause delays or issues with communication during an emergency situation. It’s important to keep your contact information up-to-date at all times.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 23R Notification of Changes to Contact Information

input: I’m unable to make my scheduled flight due to weather conditions. Can I still use the commuter policy?
output: No, the commuter policy is only applicable when you miss a flight due to personal reasons or other non-weather related issues.

input: I’ve already used the commuter policy three times this year. Can I still use it again?
output: Yes, you can only use the commuter policy up to four times in any rolling twelve-month period.

input: What happens to my monthly guarantee if I use the commuter policy?
output: Your monthly guarantee will be adjusted to reflect any lost time when you use the commuter policy.

input: Will I still get paid for the hours I spend commuting?
output: Yes, you will be paid and credited only for hours or duty worked while commuting.

input: Will my trips lost under the Commuter Policy count towards my minimum flown hours for healthcare insurance?
output: No, credit towards minimum flown hours for healthcare insurance will not be given for trips lost under the Commuter Policy.

input: What are my primary and back-up flight options within twenty-four (24) hours of departure from my commuter city?
output: Your primary and back-up flight options within twenty-four (24) hours of departure from your commuter city will be provided to you by the crew scheduler based on availability and published schedule.

input: Are the primary and back-up flights selected allowing me to report at base and check-in on-time for my assignment?
output: Yes, the primary and back-up flights selected will allow you to report at base and check-in on-time for your assignment, provided that they are per the published schedule.

input: How will my monthly guarantee be adjusted if I select a flight with available seat(s) or jumpseat within twenty-four (24) hours of departure?
output: Your monthly guarantee will be adjusted to reflect any lost time when you select a primary and back-up flight with available seat(s) or jumpseat within twenty-four (24) hours of departure from your commuter city.

input: How am I paid for trips lost under the Commuter Policy?
output: You will be paid and credited only for hours or duty worked when you select a primary and back-up flight with available seat(s) or jumpseat within twenty-four (24) hours of departure from your commuter city. Credit towards minimum flown hours for healthcare insurance will not be given for trips lost under the Commuter Policy.

input: What should I do if my first flight is oversold, delayed, canceled, or I am not boarded for any reason?
output: If your first flight is oversold, delayed, canceled, or you are not boarded for any reason, you shall notify Crew Scheduling immediately. Crew Scheduling will take one of the following actions based on their discretion: purchase a ticket for you on the next available flight, make you a space positive reservation over Company lines, advise you to attempt to board the second flight through normal means, assign you to an open trip pairing, or assign you to reserve duty for the remaining calendar days of your original trip.

input: What should I do if I am unable to board the second planned commuter flight?
output: If you are unable to board the second planned commuter flight for any reason, you shall notify Crew Scheduling immediately. Crew Scheduling will take one of the following actions based on their discretion: assign you to an open trip pairing, assign you to an open trip departing from your commuting location, assign you to reserve duty for the remaining calendar days of your original trip, or release you from all duty in a non-pay status for the missed trip pairing.

input: What happens if the Company is unable to assign me to open flying or does not assign me to reserve duty on any day of the dropped trip?
output: If the Company is unable to assign you to open flying or does not assign you to reserve duty on any day of the dropped trip, you will be coded as “commuter drop” (“CCD”) for that day. Flight Attendants are prohibited from picking up trips or reserve days for any day on which they are coded CCD.

input: What should I do if my first flight is oversold, delayed, or canceled when commuting?
output: You should notify Crew Scheduling immediately. Also have your backup flight as they will ask to add notes.

input: What action will Crew Scheduling take if my first flight is oversold, delayed, or canceled?
output: Crew Scheduling may purchase a ticket for you on the next available flight, make you a space positive reservation over Company lines, advise you to attempt to board the second flight through normal means, assign you to an open trip pairing, assign you to an open trip departing from your commuting location, or assign you to reserve duty for the remaining calendar days of your original trip.

input: Can Crew Scheduling purchase a ticket for me on the next available flight if my first flight is oversold, delayed, or canceled?
output: Yes, Crew Scheduling may purchase a ticket for you on the next available flight.

input: What does it mean to make a space positive reservation over Company lines?
output: Making a space positive reservation over Company lines means that you will be given a seat on a Company-operated flight, even if there are no available seats for passengers.

input: What should I do if I am not boarded for any reason?
output: You should notify Crew Scheduling immediately.

input: What action will Crew Scheduling take if I am not boarded for any reason?
output: Crew Scheduling may purchase a ticket for you on the next available flight, make you a space positive reservation over Company lines, advise you to attempt to board the second flight through normal means, assign you to an open trip pairing, assign you to an open trip departing from your commuting location, or assign you to reserve duty for the remaining calendar days of your original trip.

input: Can Crew Scheduling purchase a ticket for me on the next available flight if I am not boarded for any reason?
output: Yes, Crew Scheduling may purchase a ticket for you on the next available flight.

input: What does it mean to advise me to attempt to board the second flight through normal means?
output: Advising you to attempt to board the second flight through normal means means that you should try to get on the next flight as a regular passenger, using methods such as jumpseat, non-rev travel, or OA pass.

input: What does it mean to assign me to an open trip pairing?
output: Assigning you to an open trip pairing means that you will be paired with another flight attendant who has also not been assigned to a trip, and together you will work the flights for which you have been assigned.

input: What does it mean to assign me to reserve duty for the remaining calendar days of my original trip?
output: Assigning you to reserve duty for the remaining calendar days of your original trip means that you will be on standby, ready to work if needed, for the rest of your originally scheduled trip.

input: What should I do if I am unable to board the second planned commuter flight?
output: You should notify Crew Scheduling immediately.

input: What action will Crew Scheduling take if I am unable to board the second planned commuter flight?
output: Crew Scheduling may assign you an open trip pairing, assign you to an open trip departing from your commuting location, assign you to reserve duty for the remaining calendar days of your original trip, or release you from all duty in a non-pay status for the missed trip pairing for the original trip footprint.

input: Can Crew Scheduling assign me an open trip pairing if I am unable to board the second planned commuter flight?
output: Yes, Crew Scheduling may assign you an open trip pairing.

input: What does it mean to be coded as “commuter drop” (“CCD”) for that day?
output: Being coded as “commuter drop” (“CCD”) for that day means that you will not be able to pick up trips or reserve days for that day.

input: What should I do if the Company is unable to assign me to open flying or does not assign me to reserve duty on any day of the dropped trip?
output: If the Company is unable to assign you to open flying or does not assign you to reserve duty on any day of the dropped trip, you will be coded as “commuter drop” (“CCD”) for that day and will not be able to pick up trips or reserve days for that day.

input: What should I do if I am unable to report by my designated check-in time?
output: If you are unable to report by your designated check-in time, you should notify Crew Scheduling immediately.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 25D2 Commuter Late Check in

input: Can I still take my original trip if I am able to report prior to departure?
output: Yes, you can still take your original trip if you are able to report prior to departure, provided it is not anticipated to result in a flight delay.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 25D2 Commuter Late Check in

input: What should I do if I am a Reserve who has reported to the airport and am not utilized as a result of this provision?
output: If you are a Reserve who has reported to the airport and are not utilized as a result of this provision, you will be assigned to Ready Reserve duty.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 25D2 Commuter Late Check in

input: What documentation do I need to maintain to utilize the Commuter Policy?
output: To utilize the Commuter Policy, you must maintain substantiating your listing(s), including but not limited to a mandatory printout or screen shot of generated listings (e.g., autoconfirmation generated from website), boarding documents, and/or screenshot of gate monitors showing standby list.

input: When should I provide the required documentation to the Company?
output: You should provide the required documentation at the Company’s discretion and/or request.

input: What protection does the Commuter Policy provide me from dependability corrective action?
output: The Commuter Policy protects you from the dependability corrective action (four times in any twelve-month period) if a circumstance beyond your control prevents you from reporting at base on-time for your assignment.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 25F Commuter Corrective Action Protection

input: What may happen to me if the Company is unable to verify that I complied with the requirements of the Commuter Policy?
output: If the Company is unable to verify that you complied with the requirements of the Commuter Policy, you may be subject to disciplinary action.
cba_section: QA_CBA Section 25F Commuter Corrective Action Protection
